The courtesy car to the Spanish Steps was also good and was quite prepared to drop you at points on the way to the Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Rome -- Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: napmurphy
Reviews.Content: Pool like an oasis from the summer heat. Super thoughful staff. Elegant. Van to the Spanish Steps and back every 30 minutes. Skip Russes, Eden and the rest. This is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: skurf
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much the hotel nice swimming pool to relax after or before discovering Rome delicious breakfast and friendly concierge we were upgraded and the room we stayed in had been completely refurbished and was very comfortable the hotel is a bit far from the city centre but they have a shuttle or you take the cab not expensive around 10 euros and to my knowledge it is the only LHW in Rome which has a swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great outdoor pool!”
Reviews.Author: SusieFx
Reviews.Content: An outdoor pool is a must in Rome when the temperature reaches nearly 40 degrees at this time of year. The Rooms are air conditioned and the breakfast is fantastic! A good all round hotel which is conveniently situated for the Centre. The only negatives I would give is the Service was a bit slow during the day for drinks etc The evening service in the "Baby" restaurant is totally different, it seemed totally seperate from the hotel. All the staff in the hotel were friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “good alround hotel”
Reviews.Author: rohas
Reviews.Content: great hotel with the major bonus of an outdoor swimming pool, service was ok but the service round the pool was a bit mixed when it was busy. nice rooms with comfortable beds, good room service. the staff were all very polite and keen to please. would stay again when visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Grand Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyB90
Reviews.Content: We absolutely adored this grand hotel and particularly its key location, ideal for those who appreciate and love to enjoy the hectic rhythms of the ‘eternal city’ but at the same time love to have the privilege of a special retreat where privacy is guaranteed. Just few steps from Villa Borghese gardens this hotel offers the unique opportunity to enjoy jogging or simply a walk down to the Spanish Steps…where the complimentary hotel shuttle bus is ready for you to even pick you up at the end of a tiring shopping day take you back to the hotel: how fabulous! Spacious and elegant rooms and professional staff complete this magnificent frame!

Reviews.Title: “TIME OF OUR LIVES”
Reviews.Author: SROG72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aldrovandi Villa Borghese for one week and we really have to say we had the time of our lives! Days of pure relax in the pool totally pampered by the thoughtfully dedicated staff which really made us feel in paradise! Pure Italian style in the service and atmosphere: elegant but discreet, stylish but demure, we will recommend this hotel to all of our friends as The Place to be when travelling to Italy! Not to mention the fabulous restaurant baby with its windows overlooking the park, exquisite Mediterranean cuisine and excellent service, we will definitely go back soon to this unique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerers222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a visit to Aldrovandi Palace in Rome. We're avid travelers and have stayed in 5-star hotels around the world -- this hotel is among the best. The location can't be beat. It's a short cab ride from the Spanish Steps but it feels like a world away. From the gorgeous outdoor swimming pool (so rare for a big city!) to the immaculate gardens, the hotel is an enclave in the heart of the city. The service is impeccable and the rooms are comfortable and spacious. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand style”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: Lovely building with classic decoration, a lot of wood panelling and an elegant atmosphere that reminded me of the Quisisana on Capri. The hotel smells of amber, like the Plaza Athenee in Paris, another of my favourites. The rooms are comfortable but a little dated, especially some of the bathrooms. The attention to detail, especially the housekeeping, is among the best I have ever seen (reminded me of the Ritz in London). Great bar and very good grill restaurant in a room next to the bar decorated like a traditional English club. Breakfast is served in the gorgeous Sala Verde with a veranda overlooking the garden. The buffet is well presented but is fairly standard and not at all up to the level of the Michelin-starred restaurant. Lovely garden with pool and terrace cafe. Large fitness room but some of the Technogym equipment is out of date. Great service from all the staff, but a special mention for the waiting staff at the bar and the grill restaurant. The location is good if you want to be away from the crowds of central Rome in the summer. It is across the street from the Borghese Gardens and close to the Villa Giulia and a few other museums. The hotel has a shuttle to the Spanish Steps, but I would hesitate to use the Aldrovandi as a base for a first trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Urania289
Reviews.Content: Having seen a 5* (star) hotel when stepping out of a taxi, I've expected the appropriate service. Alas, only the front desk staff was friendly. The rest was pretty much disappointing. First, a waiter happily forgot my order for water at the pool bar and I've been waiting 15 minutes to catch at attention of another staff member. Second, in a lobby bar one of the waiters was extremely strange - first, he was not offering any solution to my request for green tea instead of black and finally, he brought me a package 15 min later with such a face expression as if he was doing me (the guest!!!) a HUGE favor. Such things are intolerable for a hotel which positions itself as a 5-star one. The few positive points I can name is a pool, cleanness of the room and an excellent breakfast (and staff serving breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: trav60
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for the first time and friends told us to look for a nice hotel as a bad hotel can spoil your trip to this beautiful city. As we expected the weather to be very hot we based our search for a hotel on an outdoor swimming pool. And the pool held what it promised, very refreshing surrounded by a beautiful garden. We booked a pool view room, which is essential as there is a tram passing the front of the hotel! The location is not perfect but the shuttle service is excellent. A taxi will cost you between 10 and 20 Euros from the centre of Rome. The service was excellent, and the hotel itself just beautiful. A little tip, by pure luck we got to a restaurant on top of one of the hills of Rome called "The View", not only fantastic food, but as it says in the name, the view over Rome was fantastic. That you have to try the hotel's own restaurant "Baby" goes without saying- oh Baby!

Reviews.Title: “It's a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: JazzgirlWisconsin
Reviews.Content: First of all, I disagree with many of the things the dubai reviewer said about this hotel. It sounds like this reviewer has never been to places like New York City, where smallish rooms are the norm. We thought the hotel was very beautiful and our rooms were lovely. It is definitely worth it to ask for a room facing the pool/courtyard as the main road is right at the front of the hotel. It is a very expensive, old-school elegance hotel - much like the Del Coronado in California (which also has very small rooms, BTW). If you stay at a place like this, you can expect to pay a lot for everything. While we weren't exactly charging up the pool drinks and room service because of this, we still really enjoyed the beauty and elegance of the hotel. We thought the staff was very friendly, especially the doormen. The front desk staff is a little more reserved but also very helpful. The location of this hotel is the biggest downside - you can't really walk anywhere from here. If you need to find a store, take a left from the front entrance and follow the train tracks until you reach civilization - my husband and I found a great grocery store finally so we could have some snacks in our room one day. However, if I were you, I would pick up what you need before you return to the hotel. The shuttle is a nice amenity - you have to reserve your space so be prepared to take cabs if you can't get on one and are ready to go somewhere. I would recommend this hotel, but would not stay there again ONLY because of the location. It would be more fun to be on the Via Venetta or other place within close walking of Spanish steps or at least a subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Hepu
Reviews.Content: The stay was expensive and hotel rated high so I expected to get value for money. BUT, the hotel is very old fashioned and room needed a face lift. When we went to the room and put the air conditioning on, it made terrible smell to the room as it was not cleaned or used for a while. Room had a carpet floor, which created untidy impression. Quite busy street was right under our window which made the stay a bit noisy. Location is not the most convenient to see the major sights - on the other hand Borghese park right next to the hotel is good for jogging and relaxing. Breakfast was luxorious. I felt it was bad service that we did not get iron and ironboard to the room even though we requested but were forced to utilize the expensive ironing services from hotel. I'm type of person who wants to do it myself. All in all, maybe some old fashioned people like this hotel but not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Old-world hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Soma_Sengupta
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. As noted by others, the rooms are a little small. But they contain everything necessary for comfort. The staff do all they can to help, including calling our restaurant to say we were running late, finding vases and helping to trim flowers, offering to show us various rooms we might find comfortabe. The breakfast buffet is fantastic and set us up for the day. The free shuttle, every 15 minutes, to and from the Spanish Steps was a huge help. The only suggestion I would make is this: When we went the hotel was far from full and it seemed obvious that the better rooms on the higher floors were probably unoccupied. It would have been smart for the hotel to offer free upgrades to these rooms, as many hotels would have done.

Reviews.Title: “high reputation for poor deliverables”
Reviews.Author: european_tourist_sad
Reviews.Content: i would like to be reasonable and fair for this hotel so i will mention all the hotel is classy and clean but not very impressive , nothing walking distance close no shop to buy anything no water or coffee or tea facilities in room the concierge are very pushy to take your bag even if it is a wallet to grasp tip the room are so small ( maybe the smallest in the world ) the chair for the desk is sticking to the bed it is less than 9 square meter space the food is the poorest ever in the world , i dont imagine how stingy a 5 star hotel server 1 main dish pasta only , i stayed 5 days in hotel i didnt see no fish , no meat no chicken , i felt whole italy are vegetarian , one of the days the main dish was plain yellow rice boiled with yellow cheese the dinner and lunch were soooooooo poooooor they even filled preset salad disheds filled in order to fill the huge empty pooor table , i never thought what stingy means till i saw this hotel the business room is very small 2 PC's one only is working the hotel rate is one of the most expensive hotels rate was 500 euro and the special discounted was 450 unbelievable expensive , internet rate is ridiculous expensive if you dare to order from the room service , try to save 200 euro for a burger or compatible meal drink is outrageously priced specially cocktails i have been traveling extensively around the worlld and i spent 20 years in hotel and airline business and was among hotel judges for several years i can rate this hotel of 3 stars and the room rate not to exceed 130 euro i recommend to fire the chef for his stinginess and poor taste and lousy food actually there was no food i do not recommend anyone to stay in this hotel i regret having such a bad experience in rome that will never forget im willing to send pictures to prove what i m saying i recommend tripadvisor to lower their rating and making among the worse ones or even take them out of your ranking

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: AandAinthesun
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel about 25 minute walk to the Spanish steps. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Gorgeous bathroom although I felt the decor was slightly dated in the room. Lovely breakfast (continental and cooked) but it's a bit expensive if not included in the price - 33 euros! Drinks were also a little pricey in the lounge bar, 9 euros for a small beer. One small quibble, we asked for an iron and were told laundry could only be sent away, it cost 20 euros to have a dress pressed, so pack your travel iron! Very nice pool area with attentive service. A lovely stay in Rome away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in excellent location slightly away from the madness of the city”
Reviews.Author: B_Dublin
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay with very helpful staff. Request a room overlooking the garden / pool and facing the inside area. Ground floor might be a bit close to the road. Staff very helpful and an excellent Michelin star restaurant which is surprising good value (for Rome). Very pleasant stay and would definitely return. But its not cheap.....

Reviews.Title: “Elgant, Beautiful, Impeccable Service!”
Reviews.Author: dbb123
Reviews.Content: Pros: Absolutely gorgeous, top-notch breakfast buffet (included in some packages), beautiful rooms, and service is the best we've ever enjoyed. Concierge Guiseppe is THE BEST- professional but warm, helpful in making complex arrangements to simple advice. All staff we encountered was warm, helpful and English-speaking. They knew it was our 20th anniversary, and champagned and desserts were waiting for us when we arrived as well as an upgraded room. Con: only one- not the most convenient location, as it is beyond the city walls to the north. You are near the Borghese Museum. Villa Borghese, and National Museum- and an easy walk to Via Veneto for excellent dining and shopping- but a long walk from many top sites. The hotel runs a free shuttle to Spanish Steps every 20 minutes, however, which really helps. Highly recommend the nightlife around Spanish steps and Trevi fountain- always buzzing with people and activity!

Reviews.Title: “So nearly perfect.”
Reviews.Author: MCGKnowle
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hotel, in a lovely setting and with service which is truly worthy of its five star status. However, what could have been an excellent all round stay was let down by a room which I didn’t feel matched the high standards of the rest of the Hotel. The room, although spotless and presented well, I found small and unfortunately had fairly thin walls. On the positive side it did have a beautiful view of the garden and pool to the rear. The location is perfect if you want to be away from the constant bustle of the city centre and the shuttle bus that is offered free of charge is invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff need an "attitude adjustment"...”
Reviews.Author: gojojo22
Reviews.Content: I've stayed @ this hotel three times in the past several years. Initially, I overlooked the staff's condescending & pompous attitude but have finally decided that I've had enough! On my most recent visit, I made multiple requests for information about a nearby museum as well as the operating hours of a special exhibit at the Villa Borghese---all that I rec'd were excuses & empty promises that someone would provide me w/the information 'later today'---this continued for 3 days in a row! In addition, the hotel's 'complimentary' Van service to & from the Spanish Steps was extremely disappointing & frustrating: reservations are required for this service due to the limited number of seats available. The process actually turned into a fierce competition among the Guests--each of whom were vying for the small number available seats for each trip. On two occasions, we were forced to pay for a 'taxi' to take us to the Spanish Steps since the Van was full hours in advance...and the front desk refused to reimburse us for our expense! There are many other hotels in Rome that offer exceptional accommodations, are in more convenient locations, provide outstanding service & sincerely appreciate their clientele...I will no longer patronize a hotel where I am treated so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “ROME'S FINEST HOTEL WITHOUT A DOUBT”
Reviews.Author: bonniemreeves
Reviews.Content: We use:Leading Hotel of the World as a "Bible" when traveling. Nonetheless, we were not prepared for the experience of our 5 nights here. Flawless!! The hotel is elegant yet unpretentious--staff warm and accommodating. The location in the midst of the Borghese Park was a real draw--far enough away from the hustle of downtown Rome--adjacent to many wonderful restaurants just a short cab ride away. Gorgeous park across the street with huge expanses of trees--an urban oasis. Of the dozens of hotels in its class I would rank it at the very top of all the hotels we have stated in over the years due to the quality of the personnel and the elegance of the surroundings and hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: j0j068
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend, this hotel was lovely very friendly staff very clean and comfortable rooms. Our room was at the front of the hotel so was noisy but at night with the shutters closed it wasn't to bad. We walked into the main centre of Rome daily 20-30mins but you can get the free shuttle bus. We ate at the Baby resturant very expensive, a lovely meal and very good service but I would say overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Italy's Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobS3
Reviews.Content: What can I say about a hotel that was rated the second best hotel in the world by Travel and Leisure. It's only drawback is the distance to a metro stop. The hotel offered a free shuttle to the nearest stop about five minutes away. The hotel's restaurant, "Baby," was ranked the best restaurant in Rome. The waiting list was so long, we couldn't get in.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: PeterBColchester
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two night break (primarily to watch the rugby!) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was delightful and the staff couldn't really do enough for us. My wife wasn't well during our stay so we had room service for breakfast - superb. The "Grill" restaurant does need to improve it's menu - the hotel suffers from having a top of the range restaurant (very dear) and the "Grill" restaurant which only really serves basic snacks. The hotel could do with a mid-range restaurant serving pasta, steak etc to be a complete package. The walk through the park to the Spanish Steps is lovely (though not advised at night) - taxi's to and from are not too dear however. We enjoyed being a little way from the hustle of the city centre. Overall a really beautiful hotel - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel but worth paying for?”
Reviews.Author: ScotsJohn
Reviews.Content: I stated here recently for 2 nights for a weekend break in Rome with my wife. The Hotel is quite lovely inside and the suite we had was spacious, luxurious and everything you would want from a 5 star hotel. Staff were efficient but lacked any kind of friendliness, which you sometime get in upmarket hotels. The hotel is located on the far side of the Borghese gardens from the main centre of Rome i.e. the Corso, Spanish steps etc and is therefore a 25 minute walk through parkland to the crowds and site seeing areas. The walk is quite pleasant through the park but we were recommended not to do it at night. The hotel has a shuttle bus service but we didn't use this so I can't comment on it. The only questionable element to the hotel are the dining facilities. They have 2 options, the first is a Michelin star restaurant called "Baby", which looked very nice but only had a set menu when we were there that was 180 Euros per person. The other option was something called the "Grill" but it did not in fact grill anything other than sandwiches, in other words it was a fancy snack bar. Cost is a relative thing but 180 Euros per person is too pricey for us, so got a taxi into town but it might be acceptable to others, so make your own mind up. Overall a really nice place, would I return, probably not just due to the hassle of having to get taxis everywhere after dark.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Excellence - A wonderful stay in a magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PThornhill
Reviews.Content: I could not speakly more highly of this hotel. The Aldrovandi Palace is 5 star in every respect, offering its guests luxuriously appointed rooms and a level of service that is of the highest calibre. I have rarely encountered such accomodating and friendly staff, from the ever helpful concierge ,to the driver of the complimentary shuttle bus to the housekeeping staff. The breakfast waiting staff also deserve special mention. Should I ever return to Rome the Aldrovandi Palace shall undoubtedly be my hotel of choice. A sincere thank you to all the staff who made our stay such a pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing, Truly Gorgeous that Set the Tone for Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SuperChooper
Reviews.Content: We chose 3 nights at Aldrovandi Palace as our Roman Honeymoon stay prior to our Cruise to Athens. The hotel is located in the north end of Villa Borghese away from hustle-bustle part of the city and that promises a relaxing, tranquil, surrounded by beautiful green environment. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a Garden View room as soon as the front desk found out that we were on honeymoon. We explored the Spanish Steps area since our assigned room was not ready; what a surprise that a chilled bottle of bubbly and cookies awaited us in our room! The room was nice size for two of us with high ceiling overlooking the garden and the pool. We didn't feel congested at all. A typical two-singles-put-together King size bed (standard for any European hotel) and a well-lit full bathroom. The breakfast buffet is wonderful, so be sure to include it when booking. The lobby bar serves food even after midnight. The hotel shuttle van runs every 30 min. to the Spanish Steps except between 1300-1400 hours. Reserve your return seat to the hotel especially at night since many guests tend to show up late night at the pickup point, and the van can only hold 8 passengers. We walked everywhere right thouth the Villa Borghese even late night and discovered so many beautiful spots overlooking the city. It's a nice 20 min. walk crossing the Villa. We only used taxi to the Vatican (about 12 Euro). We purposely walked to enjoy everything about Rome on foot and enjoyed side-tracking. Bring a good pair of walking shoes to walk on many uneven serface and hills. If you enjoy walking around the town, this hotel is a truly wonderful place to stay. We are so glad that we chose Aldrovandi Palace and planning on another stay in the future. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, just a shame about the beds!!”
Reviews.Author: Johnyhard1
Reviews.Content: Overall i thought the hotel was excellent.The staff were very professional.The only downside was the bed.It was rock hard,as was my brother in laws bed. We were told that they were all like it. Also, the only way of cooling the room was to keep the window open as the Air Con was turned off at this time of year. This resulted in a dozen or so insect bites. My family had not told the Hotel that it was my birthday, but i did arrive in my room that evening to find a bottle of Sparkling on ice. A very nice touch. All in all it was a very nice experience. just a shame about the bed and the temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel further enhanced by impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended a 3 week European holiday with a 5 day stay at the Aldrovandi. This hotel truly earns its five star rating. The building and decor are coolly elegant, modern yet richly Italian in design and "feel". Both the public spaces and the rooms were immaculately clean and well-maintained. They offer a wonderful turn down service in the evenings that makes you feel even more catered to. The breakfast buffet was simply amazing - abundant, varied and delicous food, beautifully presented and offered with gracious, attentive service. Speaking of service, I can't say enough about the staff - we Americans could learn alot from the studying the staff - at all levels - at this hotel. The concierge Mario was especially helpful, professional and just incredibly service-oriented. The shuttle service was great and being out of the wonderful but chaotic center of Rome was very relaxing as was staying in the midst of the beautiful Borghese Gardens. Also, we totally enjoyed the outdoor spaces, which were not at all for exclusive use of guests of Baby, contrary to another reviewer's comment, and we were able to use the shuttle service whenever we needed/wanted it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hideaway with some strange bits”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone4ever
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant and beautiful, apart from the awkward manekins that greet you in the lobby. The pool/garden area is lovely but you can't sit out during the evening unless you're eating at Baby restaurant and the inside lounge is rather gloomy. The food options are very limited if you're not eating at Baby. The alternative 'Grill' restaurant only serves snacks and salads and strangely nothing 'grilled'. Breakfast is very good but a bit chaotic. The shuttle bus service to the spanish steps would be handy if it wasn't booked up in advance for the times you're likely to want to use it. I enjoyed my stay overall but will rather stay somehwere else with outside space that you can hang out in in the evening and more relaxed dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Leading Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: RalphLD
Reviews.Content: Fortunate to have 3 nights on a business trip at Aldrovandi Palace. Rooms are better than average for Italy (I know it's 5 stars but anyone having been to Italy will know what I mean!) - a deserved member of the Leading Hotels of The World! Beautiful courtyard and great service. Villa Borghese is wonderful and, whilst not in the heart of the city, the hotel provides a free shuttle to the Spanish Steps for convenient walking (v close to Trevi Fountain & then 10-15min walk to the Colloseum). Not that I paid but wouldn't be cheap but would recommend for that 'special' weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: sandrewsBrighton
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel, its a twenty minute walk through beutaiful gardens to the sapnsih steps and far enough away to escape the city by the pool. I never want internet acces when i`m away but can see how that is strange for some people BUT this is not a modern hotel so expect old class elegance. It was my and my new new husbands first visit to Rome and our honeymoon, and I have to say from the moment the car and driver met us at the airport our stay was magnificent. All the staff especially the delightful concierge where incredibly helpful and amazed me at even supply a bottle of champagne! We could not fault your hotel and especially the staff who I think make the hotel so special. We will definitely be recommending your hotel to anyone who will listen and we will definitely be coming again, maybe for our anniversary ! Many Thanks again for making our honeymoon. Sue Andrews (Mrs)

Reviews.Title: “BEautiful pool, fabulous restaurant, tranquil setting, amenities lacking”
Reviews.Author: twospoons
Reviews.Content: FIRST THE BAD: We have stayed a a number of 5 star properties all over the world, and we expect them to keep up with technological advances as well as service levels. The Aldrovandi seems to be lagging a bit. I personally hate having to pay for internet access! I always get a significantly upgraded room, and having to hand over an extra 22 euros a day or 20 euros an hour in the business center is just galling. We did find a few small details lacking at the Aldro. Small things, such as the expensive wireless internet being broken, or being unavailable at the pool, or having a selection of just one type of beer at the terace bar, or the cramped "business center" with its painfully slow computers where you have to pay 0.35 euros (about 45 US cents) to print one sheet of paper, were niggling little problems, but these are what we remember when we choose a hotel. Quite honestly, if it were not for the pool, we would choose another hotel. Next the goods: The pool, the terrace and it's bar (and especially the waitstaff there) are superb. The calm, invigorating, luxurious and exclusive oasis the pool area provides are essential to our sence of balance when we travel to Rome, that most hurly-burly of cities. The michelin starred restaurant Baby is also superb and the service is worth a second star. Quick note: We always rent a scooter while at the Aldrovandri - the shuttle service is not really very good and is limited to one location, and the hotel is too far from most of Rome to walk. A better more flexible shuttle would be a huge boost to the Aldro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in chic location for romance or business”
Reviews.Author: AzzurraT
Reviews.Content: The Aldrovandi Palace hotel has been the right choice: 4 days with my boyfriend to relax and discover Rome. Located in a chic area of Rome but still 10 min walking from Spanish Steps and the rest of the historical city center, the hotel offers even a shuttle service up to late hours to the center and back. The service was great, very kind and helpful personnel, the room was stunning with a great bathroom (TV in the mirror too!!). Moreover the hotel has a peaceful and chic swimming pool to relax, where a great garden bar serves fresh and tasteful lunches. On top of this, in the hotel you can dine at one of the best restaurants of the city "Baby", with Michelin starred chef Alfonso!! Great stay, hope to be back soon...the hotel was so good that it was really hard to get out and visit the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property, yet not central”
Reviews.Author: tengohambre2
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at the Aldrovandi. The hotel is first rate. Our rooms were recently renovated, nice size, spotless, modern appointments. Big comfy beds. Great bathroom, large, with every amenity. Housekeeping was likewise first rate, as was turn down service. Beautiful comfy robes and towels, the flat screen TV had a good selection of int'l channels. Huge windows in the rooms, with electronic shudders. The AC worked well. The lobby is large, usually not crowded. Not many people seemed to congregate there, however. Little bar area in the back, where there was a good selection of int'l newspapers. Breakfast is outstanding. I think it runs 30 Euros pp or so but ours was included in the room rate. Try for this if you can. The selection was terrific, quality of all items also great. Fresh mozzarella, beautiful prosciutto and hams, great croissants and some of the best baked goods we have had. An ethereal lemon cake, and some excellent blueberry and apricot baked goods. Excellent coffee, fresh juices. Waiter service was professional and prompt. One of our principal reasons for choosing the hotel also was due to the pool. It is in a very well done garden area, almost resorty. Huge and well trimmed trees, large size pool for swimming. Many loungers but, as expected, in August they can get full in the afternoon. Yet, the pool staff were very on the ball in making sure they pulled out additional chairs and/or got you seated as soon as someone left. Concierge service was friendly and on the ball. Good recommendations and always ready with a map and pen to guide you. The porters likewise were friendly and professional, ditto the driver of the hotel shuttle, which is a real plus for the hotel. Of note, the shuttle will also drop you off at Piazza de Popolo or similar, not just at the bottom of the Spanish Steps. The one downside to the property -- and we do think its a real downside -- is the location. Yes, it might be a not too far walk from "the city" so to speak but, there is nothing immediately around the hotel. When I asked where we could go to pick up some water and such (the bottle we paid for in the frigo bar was 9 Euros), we were told it was a good ten+ minute walk. The same for a bank for an ATM. In truth, when we travel, we realize location is almost everything. We would have liked to be more in the bustle of Rome. To walk outside and see things, people, cafes, restaurants, etc. That isn't the case at the Aldrovandi. While it may indeed be quieter at the Adlrovandi, we are fine with some city noise. And, for restaurants, sites to see, etc., we were in taxis most everywhere. Those aren't exorbitantly expensive (though not cheap), but its nice to walk places. In short, for a summer visit, with that great pool, it probably can't be beat in Rome and we wouldn't hesitate to return. If we return in the winter, we might head to a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for relaxing but still in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: soton405
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers you everything - hectic city centre of Rome is reachable in 10min walk through beautiful park (alternatively a shuttle operated by the hotel will take you at Spanish steps or back) and at the same time the back yard of the hotel together with the pool and gourmee restaurants offers you most relaxing atmosphere to escape from the hectic surroundings - perfect! During the stay the hotel stuff where invisible but always there to help you when needed, thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon.. Great expectations but not quality service”
Reviews.Author: UKLondonReviewer
Reviews.Content: Great expectations from the website, a booking for a garden view plus honeymooner status... poor quality shabby 1970s room that felt like it was stuck up in the attic, no view of garden or pool unless you craned your neck. Incomplete TV reception on an enormous vintage set, no wifi (had to go to outdated business centre and then asked to pay...which seems so tight given price of rooms) only mens magazines on side table, awful complimentary shampoo etc (not even conditioner)....in fact a no sense of luxury at all. We asked to swap rooms which they reluctantly did after an hour's wait - a junior suite instead, facing the road which was fine and more modern. Large empty lobby, no papers, no real local information (surprising given it's next to the most fabulous garden with Villa etc nearby), gym was really unappealing and out of date. The only great thing was the pool which was wonderful. We did not try Baby restaurant as it looked so empty! DIsappointing really, but thankfully Rome is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loisma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aldrovandi Palace to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary and it was simply perfect. The hotel is spotless. the rooms are spacious and beautifully maintained. It was fantastic having a swimming pool after a hot day sightseeing and the service around this area was first class. The shuttle service to the Spanish steps was reliable and it was a pleasure to eat out each evening under the moonlight. All the staff were friendly, professional and efficient. We are planning our next trip already.

Reviews.Title: “great service and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: judi2
Reviews.Content: my husband and I decided to stay at the Aldrovandi Palace because it has an outdoor pool. We were meeting someone from the Vatican and were not touring Rome, had been there numerous times. The hotel has a large lobby. The concierge and reception staff were helpful with transfers, restaurant reservations, etc. There were many people staying there because of the pool. The location is just a little out of the way. It takes 20 minutes to walk through the park to the via Veneto or Spanish steps. They have a van that runs often. You just have to make a reservation. We had no problem with that. Our room was a little small, but we got a great deal with 1800HOTELS. $219 US with full breakfast a night. The maid service was fabulous, amenities were great. Service in the dining room for breakfast was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous trip”
Reviews.Author: cornellmadhouse
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Rome but our first with the children and our first to this hotel - but it won't be our last. Can't praise it highly enough, the staff were great - very polite and helpful and the rooms - although not overly large were well decorated and very very clean. We included the breakfast cost when booking the trip and were expecting a small continental affair, but the choice was good and included cooked aswell. The pool area, though not huge was very clean and felt suprisingly secluded, with pool attendants always on hand to provide you with a row of sunbeds should you need them. The hotel is in a good position just across the road from the borghese gardens which are nice to walk through to get to the main attractions although the hotel shuttle offered a fast and friendly service to the centre of things should you need it (booking with the concierge the previous evening is recommended if you require a morning service). All in all we had a fabulous time and will definitely return to Rome and the Aldrovandi.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: 4georgie4
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Aldrovandi Palace for 6 nights and I can honestly say it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It is a little out of the way however the hotel has a shuttle bus that takes you to the Spanish steps and picks you up. From there you can catch the metro to all the main sites which I would advise doing as taxi's are very expensive. There is also a tram stop outside the hotel which is handy. We booked a king size room however we were given a room with two single beds pushed together. We asked to be moved and we were straight away. They upgraded us to a superior room as they were fully booked. This room was lovely, it had a very big bathroom and massive bed and it even had a TV in the bathroom mirror. Some of the staff were a little abrupt at times but I think its just the way they are. The majority of them couldn't have been more helpful. I'm not one for name dropping but a guy named Alessio was especially helpful and genuinely interested in how we were spending our days. We had breakfast included which was good as the food and drink was VERY expensive (a bottle of water was 7 euros). It was very nice and the waiting staff were great. The coffee is EXCELLENT! The main thing that was good about this hotel was that it had a swimming pool, so of an afternoon after a long day of sightseeing it was nice to just chillout. They give you a cushion for the sunbeds and a towel which made it even more relaxing. All in all we had a fantstic time however bare in mind it is expensive. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a relaxing little hideaway in a touristy place.

Reviews.Title: “So many niceties. Too many essentials not addressed.”
Reviews.Author: KateOK
Reviews.Content: I've labored over this review, asking all the members of my family what they thought of the Aldrovandi & I also went back and re-read the glowing reports from past TA's about this hotel. I traveled with my family: husband, two teenagers (15 & 18) to Rome (yes, in the crazy heat of August...) and booked the Aldrovandi through Leading Hotels of the World. LHW (and Merritt) were extremely helpful with my booking, changing my reservation when a summer special was offered at European LHW. She is fantastic. We chose the Aldrovandi over other five-star Rome hotels because of the pool. Our family could only travel during this time slot & we thought after hot Rome sightseeing, it would be wondrful take a cool dip in a pool. And the pool really served us well. The location is not ideal, above the Borgese Gardens, but we were very aware of this, realizing that the pool took presidence over a city-center location. The hotel offers a shuttle. Their shuttle system leaves a lot to be desired. Management couldn't always fit our family into the bus, or the shuttle wasn't back for an hour..those sorts of issues. We found taxis in Rome to be reasonable, safe, and clean. We did walk down into Rome center, which was not far, about 15 minutes, and all downhill, so it is certainly managable---just dusty and hot. The hotel lobby is in the old classic style: marble floors, high ceilings, velvet and chintz chairs and couches. A small sweet bar is tucked off in a corner and the front desk is rich wood. Bellman and concierges are professional. The breakfast buffet, which was included in our rate, was gorgeous & was served in a dining room overlooking the gardens on the grounds. Service at breakfast was excellent. We did not eat at the gourmet restaurant, "Baby," but did have drinks at the pool and snacks at the beautiful outdoor patio. We booked two suites with garden views. The teens first rooms were smoke filled and the hotel quickly moved them to a different suite on the same floor. My husband and I were at the end of the hall on the 3rd floor. To get to our rooms, we took a very quaint tiny elevator. Our rooms were in the corner of the hotel, with no real view. The suite was quite large, with a sitting room, bedroom ,and bath. But here is where I begin to wonder about what makes a five star hotel.... One can write "eclectic furnishing and antiques" and I find it old, drab, and dark. The air-conditioning did cool the rooms, but the A/C were units attached to the base of the window sills . They were quite elementary considering the hotel's claim of five-stars, and in contrast to other five-star hotels in Rome. The bathroom was silly. "Old World?" . The bath had one small sink, a large tub/shower. The shower concept was truly old-style, reminding me of hotels from the '80's, where you really couldn't fit a (thin) body into the plastic cone-contraption and inevitably water sprayed everywhere. My husband, at 6'3" thought he was backpacking again and not paying for a luxery hotel experience. But the worst issues with the hotel were: 1. We returned home the 2nd day to no water and no water pressure. We telephoned down to the front deck. They told us that there had been a power outage on the street and that we would eventually have water pressure soon. It did come on--in a trickle--about 25 minutes later. But why had there been no notice/note put under our doors? There was absolutely no communication between guests and the front desk about what was going on, nor were we ever updated. Eventually we did have water. Cold water. And that's the way it was for the next three days. NO HOT WATER. Nope. Management kept sending someone up to take a look. Finally the young hotel concierge told us that "you are at the end of the pipe line so you must just run your water for about 20 minutes and you will get hot water." Huh? Having recently renovated two historic buildings, my husband and I knew that the hot water issue was a chronic one, with a watertank system that is old and insufficient for this five star title.. "Old World" just doesn't cut it when one is being charged over $1,250 a night. And I know I could have asked, to move our rooms...but I'm not so sure that moving would have had a positive result. Our kids, who had been moved to a new suite down the hall, had the same problem. Being in a service industry, I was also surprised that management didn't at the very least send us a bottle of champagne for the inconvenience. No apologies. No gestures of goodwill. Again, no professional courtesy extended. Aldrovandi Palace has many niceties, but management needs to address its infrastructure: water, a/c/ , bathroom, and the training of staff to communicate and placate guests when problems arise . I do not consider Aldrovandi Palace in the same catagory as all other Leading Hotels of the World or five-star accomodations. And I am sorry to have to write this. Cheers, Kate/Boston

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand how this can be leading hotel?”
Reviews.Author: CroatiaChic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old first of all, so are the rooms that feel like a three star or poor 4 star. We've paid the price as it was a top 5 star which made my dissapointment with the hotel bigger. Staff is...hm...ok, some of them. The great restaurant within the hotel did not work and we have had to use the hotel one. The waiters did not want to put 2 tables together for our group of 12 eve there was nobody else at the restaurant - they did not want to disturb other non visible guests???? We ended up (our comapny CEO and Regional Director actually) putting the tables together so we can sit. then they went out of wine we drunk, service oh my god not good. Not to forget that we have called once from the city to cancell dinner as we wanted to stay out and then we've changed our mind and called within next 5 minutes that we will not cancell. The receptionist or whoever picked up actually screamed at my colleague that this cannot be done and they've refuesed our dinner! Ended up in a great restaurant in the city afterwards which was even better then the lousy hotel restaurant. Everything we asked was a problem, but even if it was I do not see why to tell it in front of the guest???? It was witner so we did not try the pool although it looks nice. I did not notice a great location ecuase simply everything was far. I would NOT reccomend this hotel for the price they ask for and I would not go bac there if I was in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of relaxation in fascinating Rome”
Reviews.Author: jsc52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in July and had an amazing experience. Had been to Rome on several occaisons before, but this was the first time with our 8 month old baby. In adition to the basics (clean & comfortable), the hotel provided a great place to relax with the little one between touring. Lovely outdoor space with pool, nice lobby bar area, set right next to a lovely park to walk around. The hotel staff was impressive - really came through when we needed a babysitter & the host at the poolside eatery made us feel like part of a family. Yes, its a taxi ride (or lengthy walk) into the heart of Rome, but the trade-off is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Top class city hotel, with prices to match but a pool as bonus”
Reviews.Author: europtraveller
Reviews.Content: A classy hotel with all the trappings to befit the 5 star ‘Leading Hotels of the World’ tag. It also has prices to match though we managed to get a very good deal by booking through Alitalia. That said, breakfast (described as a ‘light buffet’) is on top of the room rate and is a deterrent €33 per person per day. There are no nearby shops or restaurants (the hotel's own is in the very top bracket both for prices and quality), but the hotel, which is at the north end of the Villa Borghese park, is not that far from the central parts of the city, and the hotel runs a free, reliable and efficient shuttle service every half hour in each direction to and from the Spanish Steps (the same journey is about €7 by taxi). This only holds 8, however, so needs to be booked ahead, and the first one into town is 10.00 a.m. Unusually for a hotel in the city the hotel has an excellent pool (though this is so well shaded it is actually surprisingly cool). Service is impeccable and very professional. The rooms are spacious, handsomely appointed, and with all you would expect at this level. We were surprised that throughout our stay we had problems with the water – we had to run it for about 10 minutes to get hot water, and most days it was either very discoloured or speckled with bits. A top class hotel, though with very high prices unless you can get a good deal, and if you want a pool without being a long way out, this is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Karen's 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: CenturyGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. Extremely high quality service and accommodation. We ate in the Michelin starred restaurant in the hotel which was fabulous. Even our handbags got stools!!! The restaurant was extremely expensive but both the food and service were exceptional. A wonderful place to stay but only for very special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection, pure elegance!”
Reviews.Author: DixieDeeva
Reviews.Content: There will always be someone with a complaint, you simply can't please all of the people all of the time, but please ignore their reviews! This is the most wonderful hotel, with the most helpful, sincere staff I have ever visited and I have traveled around the world a bit. Mario at the front desk is a gem! Anything I needed was within the possibilities. I have been very ill for the past few years so I needed his help often and he was very patient each and every time I spoke with him. I needed a private tour of the Vatican but I could only do 2 hours, (most minimums are 3 hours) and he found me a wonderful guide who tailored my trip for my daughter and me. The elevator was on the fritz for a bit and when I told them of it, he said, "Madam, why didn't you call me, I would have come for you'...does it get any better than that? Although I didn't appreciate one of the wait staff being in my room while the Do Not Disturb sign was on, I was gifted with a beautiful tray of fruits to keep me happy. (I'm severely hypoglycemic so food is a very important part of my trip) Nothing was taken but my tray of breads on my bedside table so the staff apologized and explained that it was taken because it was stale, true but I need to keep food handy! Even the bellmen were wonderful, courteous and kind. The rooms were immaculate, the turn down service divine, the free breakfast would please anyone. No, it's not as close to the sites as some hotels are, but it's quiet here too and a courtesy car is provided to the Spanish Steps every 30 minutes. The bellmen will call you a taxi, see you seated and offer water while you wait. Not close for me, I am unable to walk that far but to Europeans, it's a short distance, please remember that they walk everywhere because it's safe to do so. Beautifully furnished rooms, individual climate control and one of the best hotels in the world. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “A palace like no others”
Reviews.Author: figaro200
Reviews.Content: Recently coming back from a wonderful sunny weekend in Rome we truly enjoyed our stay at the Aldrovandi Palace. From our arrival to our departure, the facilities and service were top notch. Even though the hotel was busy, we always felt very well taking care off. Most of the staff was multi-lingual and the complimentary shuttle service to Piazza Spagna was excellent. It definitely compensated the fact that the hotel was a little off city center. The pool was a wonderful addition and much needed after a long day visiting Rome and breath taking sites. A great experience for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but only a moderate experience”
Reviews.Author: mxpcgn
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is really a luxury hotel but there were too many things that were unacceptable: I booked a deluxe room on a high floor with pool view but got a superior room on the first floor with view on the car parking area, the TV in my room although branded Bang and Olufson did not work, the yogurt offered at the breakfast buffet was expired....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very expensive internet conection"”
Reviews.Author: Alpe09
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Aldrovandi Palace. The first inconvenience was that Booking had not sent our reservation to the hotel. Luckily, a room was available. The hotel was nice, the service very good, the shuttle to Piazza Spagna very convenient. The only regret was the price of the Internet connection: 22 euros per day. Of course you also had the opportunity to use it by hour at the price of 10 euros/hour!!! We will not stay again in a hotel that charged that much for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location with beautiful and elegant decor!”
Reviews.Author: gyspy
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 2 nights but managed to enjoy every aspect of this fine hotel. The staff was most helpful to our every request and made the four of us feel special. We particularly enjoyed the staff at the main floor restaurant and bar as they were very warm and engaging while being very professional as they served our food and drink. We think anyone wishing to be in the Villa Borghese local would do well to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Calm Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Nobbydiesel
Reviews.Content: The previous positive reviews are pretty accurate in my opinion. The property is a beautiful former villa, located in a quiet Diplomatic area of Rome. In addition to the points made earlier about proximity to the sights of Rome, it's worth pointing out that the hotel is directly on the tram route, where you can buy a 75 minute travel ticket for 1 euro. There are also some local bars, cafes, restaurants and shops within less that 10 minutes stroll. We ate at one of these and had a lovely evening. The hotels restaurant "Baby" was superb. We had a package which included dinner. We both opted for the tasting menu, which was marvellous. Wine was reasonably priced, but cocktails appeared less so. We found that we were able to make a deal with the cab driver when returning to FCO airport, for 50 Euros, which works out the same as a cab to the Termini and then 2 tickets for the train. A cab all the way, was far more comfortable. Good communication from the front desk regarding our lost luggage and a late check out was no problem. Thoroughly enjoyable stay with a definate intention to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: superubi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my boyfriend for 2 nights, but even in such short period this place impressed us really a lot. First of all it has perfect location - just in the heart of Villa Borghese - in a peaceful zone, but very close to the center, just 10 min walking and you are in Piazza Spagna. The room was VERY spacious, perfectly equipped, clean, with new furniture and modern technics. We had both shower and bath, that is really comfortable. Breakfast was also included to the price and I can say that is one on the most rich breakfast I've ever seen - all food was really fresh, especially pastry and of course noone can re,ain hungry after such breakfast. For the guests of the hotel there was provided a shuttle bus that takes you every 30 min to the city center and then in evening brings you back. Probably the only thing that I would change in that hotel - is the Internet - it has a supplementary fee, but at the same time for Rome this thing is more than normal.

Reviews.Title: “luxury oasis”
Reviews.Author: drjohn01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aldrovandi Palace last weekend and i have to say we had a fantastic time. The hotel was beautiful; set in the tranquil villa borghese gardens it really was an oasis from the hectic and noisy city center of Rome, yet we still managed to walk everywhere- a brisk walk to the Vatican or the Colosseum took just over 45 mins, the hotel has a shuttle to the centre of Rome every hour which puts you in the centre of Rome if your not up for the walking. The hotel pool was beautiful and while it was not officially open the hotel was more than happy for us to use it and provided towels, sun loungers and even waiter service as the weather was amazing. The buffet breakfast had everything you needed and kept us filled up till dinner. Id certainly recommend it anyone especially those looking to enjoy the hetic buzz of Rome whilst staying in a peaceful luxury hotel. ill look forward to staying at the Aldrovandi Palace again. my only bone of contention is the very pricey internet- i really dont undestand how they can change so much for 24 hours of internet!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CCHLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in mid-May (room 425) and left unhappy with the experience. On the plus side we enjoyed a decent late meal from room service having arrived late on the first evening and we found the guy who served the food pleasant and welcoming. On the minus side there were a number of things which left us disappointed (i) our room was damned small and in no way resembled the photos posted on the hotel's own website (our room was tired and old in comparison); (ii) small thing but annoying - our bed had only one thin pillow per person when we got there and I had to call housekeeping for extras - I really would not expect to have to do that in a 300 Euro+ a night hotel; (iii) the swimming pool (a big selling point when booking) was closed until June (why? - the weather was glorious); (iv) the costs of PPV films and Wifi are comically high (22 Euros to watch a film, 17 Euros for 24 hours of wifi access - ludicrous both); and (v) the staff at the front desk and the door were consistently unwelcoming (particularly the older guy on the front desk who could barely manage to speak to us). At no point did we feel like we were getting the sort of service we had paid for. To me the guest directory best summed up the experience - there isn't room for a section entitled "housekeeping" or a number to call for such issues but there is a detailed section informing you of the hotel's dresscode for the various public areas. I have stayed in a good number of hotels over the years which are, like this, branded as 5 star and in the main have had a great time - this is a sad exception and I would not recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: rtwtraveller10
Reviews.Content: In this hotel everything seems to be perfect - very clean - very kind staff - very good breakfast (breakfast waiters are are kind and helpful)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel BUT...”
Reviews.Author: florent
Reviews.Content: First the plus: Great front desk and portier and bar staffs, nice and big suites (Suite 416 is great for its quietness) But numerous strong minus: 1) I still don"t get why I had to pay 35c/min for the use of Internet in the biz center + 35cts for every page printed, 2) Room service: I paid 40€ for one piece of veal + fries for my 2-year old daughter (including 15€. for the fries instead of the regular vegetables). As they don't have any child menus, you have to choose from the adults plates with no chopped steak + fries for the children 3) Room service again: One of the smallest choices I got from a 5-star hotel and don't try to ask for the Michelin-star Baby restaurant menu, they will say "No Sir no room service for this cuisine"... Totally snobish 4) When I order for some 100s of €uros, I really hate it when someone asks me if I kept a spoon, like"Are you a thief or what?" 5) The shuttle which is supposed to come and go to the Piazza di Spagna. Fully booked often or just not working until 6.25PM on week-ends. Alright, the hotel is aware of that so they offer you to ask a receipt from the cab and that will taken into account in your bill. But still, it [---]! Not very strong minus indeed but enough to make me wonder why I spent my money in a place where I had not much consideration. Finally the location: well, plus and minus. Far from the noise but also far from all of the interesting parts. Sorry, but next time I will definitely stay at the Hassler or the Inn at the Roman Forum

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: alwaysluis
Reviews.Content: Some months ago I was planning to make a romantic trip with my wife in Rome. A friend of mine suggested my wife to organize our second honeymoon at Aldrovandi Palace. I must say that he was right. Incredible hospitality, wonderfull service, lovely room, friendly staff, fantastic atmosphere......what else ! If you're looking for the best. Aldrovandi Palace is simply the best !

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: mat.
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 428 from april 4th till april 11th 2009. The hotel is excellent and the staff is very professional and courteous. The disadvantage for some because of the location somewhat away from the places of interest, was an advantage for us, since the hotel is located in a very residential, calm and safe neighbourhood. The free shuttle bus makes up for this disadvantage, although 7.25 pm as the latest return to the hotel from the Piazza di Spagna is too early. The Villa Borghese and the beautiful Galleria Borghese with magnificent sculptures of Bernini ( let the concierge of the hotel make the necessary reservations for a visit to the Galleria) are nearby and the park is lovely for a walk on a sunny day. So the hotel is perfect for a visit to Rome, without having to undergo the never ending hustle and bustle of a metropole. When you come back to the hotel after a busy day of sightseeing, with sore feet, you arrive in an oasis of peace and quiet. Our room was a nice refurbished room. Not too big, but big enough for 2. The house keeping staff did a perfect job, with turndown service in the evening. The view from the room was less. We looked out on the parking lot of the hotel, and, granted, on the very beautiful embassy of the Netherlands. One tip for people who like authentic Italian cuisine: ristorante Pararoma, 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Excellent cuisine, very reasonably priced. Certainly not a tourist trap. For those who like japanese food (even when in Italy) like us, Hamasei, not far from the Piazza di Spagna. Some points of criticism: we stayed for 7 nights in the hotel. The buffet breakfast was fine, but was the same every morning with no variation. Not everything from the warm buffet, was warm. The pastry that was on the buffet, also was the same kind every day. The cost of internet (25 EUR. for 24 hours) was too expensive. Hotels like this should offer this complimentary to their guests. And finally, when we made the reservation, we informed the hotel that it was a special trip since we celebrated our 25th marriage anniversary and we became both 50 years of age. The hotel replied that they would take that into consideration, but apparently they forgot, what shouldn' happen to a hotel belonging to the "Leading Hotels of the World". All things considered, a top hotel in a lovely city. Worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: algil
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our recent holiday in Rome particularly our stay at this hotel. We did have a problem with our first night as our room was very hot and we are unable to keep the window open due to being on the ground floor by the road. However the next morning on reporting the problem to the reception, we were moved to a much larger room overlooking the gardens. The hotel was very clean and staff freiendly. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. The shuittle bus to the Spanish Steps was very welcome as the hotel is a littleway from the sights, shame it didn't run later (last one 7.20pm) but we managed to use the Tram no19 very good value runs till midnight.

Reviews.Title: “great service, restaurant amazing, breakfast abismal!”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsbEngland
Reviews.Content: hotel staff are brilliant-couldn't fault them in particular Eva, most helpful. Our room was clean and the turn down service with chocolates lovely. Our breakfast were the main bone of contention, for a michelin star restaurant on the premises what happened in the morning? Had they employed a cleaner to whip up cold eggs, even colder cups of cappucino, and as for the rest of the "hot food"..... how they can get everything else so right beggars belief. The breakfast was like this everyday the only redeeming feature was the free paper, but how can youenjoy that when sipping tepid salty tea? Location ideal to get away from the hustleand bustle, and the free shuttle to town is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: MarinaBrazil
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at Aldrovandi Palace in November and loved the refurbishment. The Lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are fantastic, they even have TVs in the bathrooms. Regarding the location, it is a very quiet place and just a few minutes with the transfer from the Spanish Steps. By the way, transfer is gently provided by the hotel every half hour which helps a lot. The restaurant is amazing, I had a wonderful dinner with a view of the beautiful garden the Hotel has. Breakfast was delicious, all the Hotel Staff definitely made our stay more enjoyable,everyone is very charismatic. I strongly recomend this Hotel and I will definitely stay there again during my next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull loved it!”
Reviews.Author: brasucaSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank all the management staff and the on duty team. I had a wonderfull experience at the Aldrovandi Palace, everybody so friendly and eager to help. The courtesy service provided to the spanish steps, turned out to be marvellus.After a full day of wonderfull sight seeing and shopping, the van took our bags back to the hotel, and we stayed to have dinner in the area.Speaking of dinner, our first night at the Aldrovandi we had dinner at BaBy restaurant, it was simply divine! Aldrovandi Palace is full of sun shine and charisma, beautiful decor, excellent service.A very happy customer from Brazil! Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: metwrt
Reviews.Content: The Aldrovandi Palace is luxury hotel abutting Villa Borghese. The service staff are friendly and helpful. While my husband attended business meetings, I toured the city, with much guidance from the concierge. The hourly shuttle to the Spanish Steps makes it easy to get to the heart of Rome and see all the sites you go to Rome to see. The magnificent Borghese Gallery is a short walk from the hotel. The room was lovely, comfortable and clean. The lobby bar is quite pleasant, as are its servers. Our meal at Baby was exquisite. The price for breakfast is admittedly steep, but that seems to be the norm at most top-notch hotels, including those in the United States. Taxis in Rome are expensive, but the shuttle helps allay that cost. Several in our group departed at the same early hour for the flight home so the hotel arranged for a mini-bus, which was there promptly at 6 a.m. and got us to the airport in plenty of time. All in all, staying at the Aldrovandi Palace made my husband's business trip seem less like work and made my Roman holiday very special.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: kenn1
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the hotel and greated with a cold smile . We were shown to our rooms through a smelly corridor Thankfully the room did not smell as bad. Rooms basic WARNING when taking a taxi to the airport BEWARE as our taxi arrived to the hotel with 9 euros on the meter and went into the hotel to get change I reminded him the meter was running and he said it will only be euro on the meter.He then handed the porter some money 1 or 2 €5 euro notes .We got to the airport the meter read €79.80 when it should be less then €55 as the hotel concierge advised.This would lead me to belive there is a scam going on in a hotel you would not expect . Daniel the shuttle bus driver is very helpful. A bottle of heiniken is €11 at the bar espresso €9

Reviews.Title: “Time of our lives”
Reviews.Author: brokerwoods
Reviews.Content: From arriving at the hotel on Thursday last week, we were greeted by the most friendly, polite staff. We were given a brief guide to the hotel facilities, then shown to our room with a beautifull view of the pretty courtyard style gardens and pool area. The room was clean, bright and airy, and the bathroom clean, modern with bath and shower. The hotel is about a 10 minutes drive to the Spanish Steps, but the hotel provides a courtesy people carrier on the hour between 10am and 7pm then picks up at 25 past the hour - you need to pre-book this each day, but we were never refused. Our normal driver, Daniel, was a credit to the hotel as he answered every question, and even detoured one day to drop us closer to Vatican City. The hotel has a lovely lobby area with a bar which was comfortable, quiet and well serviced. Breakfast at 33 euros per head was overly expensive for what it was (especially as we only had a coffeee and a croissant) On the saturday night, which was my wife's 40th birthday, we dined at Baby. We have dined at many top restaurants in london, but nothing compared to our experience here. We opted for the taster menu, of 7 courses including scorpion fish, beef, pasta, wild mushrooms - I can not begin to describe the taste and quality. It was fairly expensive at about 180 euro's including a bottle of wine - but worth it - especially when the waiter brought out a birthday cake for my wife - totally unexpected!! The waiters were very attentive, and the decor very contemporary/minmalist. Overall, a fantastic experience that i would recommend to everyone - and one that my wife and i will not forget - thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmdhuck
Reviews.Content: In Every Aspect Magnificent Hotel! Aldrovandi Palace is one of the finest hotels in Rome. My husband and I travel to Italy often for business and pleasure and we stayed at this beautiful hotel for three days but wish we had the opportunity to stay longer. The price was reasonable for such a high quality hotel! This fine hotel is adjacent and fabulous Villa Borghese. Short walk to Etruscan museum and Villa Borghese Park. The Concierge service is just superb. The friendliest staff I've ever seen: one of them still remembered my name from a stay that was four years ago!! Fabulous! My room was spacious and spotless with Bang&Olufsen flat screen TV, gorgeous fabrics, lovely art on the walls. The beds were marvelous and comfortable. The marble bathroom was large and had new equipment and great shower and bath. The entire hotel is gorgeous and has many amenities and magnificent outdoor swimming pool. I must point out that the breakfast was the best I've seen in Italy. For breakfast we had a variety of fresh fruits, cereals, pastries, and all types of breads. Inside the hotel is a famous Michelin star restaurant. Superb choice for short stays in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Aldrovandi”
Reviews.Author: wtoolman
Reviews.Content: I do not generally comment on hotels, but this superb, newly refurbished - all in sparkly Italian marble hotel - inspired me to write a review! My teenage daughter and I have just returned from a five day stay at the Aldrovandi Palace . I booked after reading the various reviews on internet and I'm pleased to confirm that it was an excellent choice. One of the best aspect of the hotel is the service. From the doorman to the room service personnel, everyone was so friendly and professional. The service is personal and seamlessly attentive, the rooms are spotless and are experience worth. Giuseppe at concierge and his inside advices are impressed in my mind. Bedrooms offer supreme comfort, with stylish furniture. Advanced technology includes controlled air conditioning and Bang & Olufsen TV sets. The breakfast offered a fine selection of warm and cold food, fruit and a traditional Italian pastry. The breakfast room is absolutely gorgeous. Best restaurant in the city! The suits are not huge, but the garden and the swimming poll beats all in Rome . Free shuttle service, made my daughter happy, because it was vital for her frequent shopping excursions near Piazza di Spagna. Its palm garden and the Sorentino coast cuisine in the heart of Rome emphasises the holyday mood . It is within a walking distance of Villa Giulia, where my daughter and me enjoyed in of the most remarkable masterpieces of Etruscan art. Simply wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered at the Aldrovandi”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: First class treatment all the way As we arrived early they let us check in and gave us details on the facilities and major sites of Rome Our room was given a complimentary upgrade and when we returned in the evening there was a complimentary bottle of wine All the staff went out of their way to be helpful and the service was top class in the restaurant As we were leaving for the airport late in the afternoon the hotel gave us a late checkout and provided changing facilities to enable us to use the pool area I stay in hotels quite a lot and although not cheap this hotel has excellent customer service and staff

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Aldrovandi”
Reviews.Author: bright0nbelle
Reviews.Content: We were greeted warmly on our arrival at the Aldrovandi on a steaming August afternoon. The charming Patrick escorted us to our lovely adjoining rooms on the third floor. Flinging open the shutters we encountered the most delightful view of the gardens and pool. Aware of the late hour and some of the comments I had read on Tripadvisor I enquired as to the possibility of a swim, and was delighted to hear that the pool is open 24 hrs, the only caveat being, there are no pool attendants after 7pm and so you need to take your own towel down with you if you wish to swim after that. Whilst the kids cooled off in the pool, which they had completely to themselves, we sat in the wonderful shaded gardens sipping chilled Pinot Grigio and nibbling on the complimentary pizzatinis. The surroundings really are exquisite, and exactly the situation in which you would like to find yourself, after a tiring day. The only problem we encountered during our stay was the difficulty in tearing ourselves away from this little Oasis to get down to the serious business of sightseeing! The complimentary shuttle bus was excellent, leaving every hour and dropping off at the foot of the Spanish Steps. They also pick up from here at 25 past the hour. I also thoroughly recommend strolling through the Villa Borghese gardens which is a lovely way to start the day and takes no longer than twenty minutes if you don't stop along the way. The concierge were absolutely first class throughout our stay,really helpful with information and restaurant reservations. Whilst there we celebrated our sons 18th birthday and on returning to our rooms that day they had supplied a beautifully presented tray of chilled champagne and petit four and a birthday card. The restaurant they recommended, Osteria d'Antiquaria, was superb and they even arranged a Birthday cake ! If you are planning a trip to Rome during the summer months I really can't recommend The Aldrovandi Palace highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Stodgy, Dodgy Professional”
Reviews.Author: NiceNYer
Reviews.Content: What we sought was simply a home base in Rome while we overcame jet lag and prepared for a two-week Italian auto tour. We were neither pleasantly surprised, nor disappointed, finding a moderately priced small room, professional staff and a delightful pool scene smack in the middle of Rome's Central Park West! The best and most expensive rooms are on the inside, facing the pool, while we stayed on the ground floor facing a busy street . But if you are going to splurge, do so at the new Lungarno Portrait Suites hotel, which we admired on a brief look-see. On the plus side, this hotel is directly across from the Borghese Gardens (which will prove a sublime treat to all who go there for a morning jog) and the short walk to the car rental outlet best situated for leaving this hectic city, the Borghese Gardens garage or the Parioli Hertz location on via Bruno Buozzi.

Reviews.Title: “High class stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: topvini
Reviews.Content: We went for a city trip to Rome in Oct 2007. I choosed Aldrovandi from the list of the Alitalia best fares. One little issue is the reaction time on our emails to ask for the confirmation of the reservation. and on Sunday there is nobody to confirm the reservations. Once arrived, it was a great pleasure to discover this real palace. I was afraid of the distance between the hotel and the centre but you can walk through the Borghese garden or benefit from the shuttle to go tothe Spanish steps. Nice room and nice fitness room. Service was not that good as expected. There is still room for improvement. The breakfastbufet is extremely expensive and you'd better go to Piazza del popolo to have a real italian breakfast... Overall experience was very good due to the nice guys at the reception and taking care of your luggage and shuttle. I would not recommend it for people who like intimacy and small charm hotels but I would recommend for people who really like palace and who are not afraid to be a little distance away from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Getting better all the time!”
Reviews.Author: KOHG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aldrovandi Palace in May 2008 for the second time - the first time was in July 2005. Since our last visit there has been significant refurbishment and the results are fantastic! The reason for choosing the hotel again was to have a pool to relax by when we weren't sight-seeing. The pool area is lovely and the hotel provide enormous yellow towels and extremely comfortable loungers to use while sunbathing. The only downside of the pool area is that there are so many trees surrounding it you end up dodging the shade all day if you want to get a tan. There is a lot of sun though - you just need to move every now and then to stay in it. Our room was huge and had a big mirrored wall on one side which made it feel even bigger. The bathroom was enormous and we both loved it - there was a huge separate walk-in shower with a rain shower head and the whole bathroom was spotless. The hotel is expensive for "extras" - for example a 75cl bottle of water by the pool costs 6 Euros, and buffet breakfast is 33 Euros per person, but it is a 5 star hotel and the prices are no more extortionate than other similar hotels. We booked through Expedia and got a really good rate and then we minimised what we spent while we were there. It's easy enough to get water and breakfast outside of the hotel if you want to keep your costs down. Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel. It isn't cheap but it has an air of luxury about it and you get really well looked after. It's also in a nice quiet area of Rome which means you feel as though you are coming back to an oasis when you return from your sight-seeing each day.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STARS ALL ROUND - WE LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: paulom
Reviews.Content: A really beautiful hotel set in a very quiet and upmarket residential area of Rome. Plus points; Rooms beautifully crisp clean and very well appointed - beautiful pool set in lush gardens - courtesy schuttle bus to and from Spanish steps - very courteous and friendly front desk staff / and porters - (especially Danilelle who drives the schuttle bus).
