Nothing was a problem - everything we asked for was attended to immediately - we only had one meal in the hotel during our stay so we can't comment comprehensively, but the food we did have there was excellently prepared and presented. Overall - everything one would expect from a 5 star hotel in Rome. Negatives: Food is very expensive - we couldn't comment on the quality of the breakfast, but at €33 for a buffet breakfast, it would want to be something really special for me to part with that kind of money - so with the exception of one pool-side meal, we ate out. Two excellent local eateries are located at Piatza Ungaria - 10 mins walking distance - turn left out the hotel and follow the tram lines. One is the Cafe Ungaria which served breakfast and a wide range of good value snacks - and not forgetting their wonderful selection of Ice Creams. The other eaterie is the Ristorante / Taverna Rossini - which served a wonderful selection of meat and fish dishes for lunch and dinner - we didn't have one, but the steaks looked to die for! The hotel is located a little too far away from the main attractions compared with other hotels, but we felt the free schuttle and the quietness of the setting/location off-set this negative. Via Veneto is about a 12 - 15 min walk through the Viall Borghese gardens, as is the Piatza Popolo. Another very good value eaterie on the Via Veneto is the Grand Cafe Roma - at the bottom on the right hand side just before the Piatza Berberini - serves a very good 4 course breakfast for €12 - so eating breakfast out saved us €40 each time! Overall I would rate this hotel very highly - yes it is expensive but thats the cost of staying in a five star hotel in Rome. Before we booked the Aldrovandi, we had already made a reservation for another 3/4 star in a more central loaction costing €300 less for our 7 night visit. While this other hotel was rated very highly, many of the reviews mentioned traffic noise (due to it's central location) - and also that it was small and cramped - both common problems with many of the other centrally located hotels I gather. As we were celebrating a special occasion and as we were going to be staying for seven nights, we felt that comfort was very important to us and and on that basis, we decided to cancel our inital booking of the other centrally located hotel, and instead, spend the extra for guaranteed 5 star luxury at the Aldrovandi Palace - (about €45 a night extra) and I have to say, that is exactly what we got - definitely money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but great”
Reviews.Author: J&CYorks
Reviews.Content: Largely as other positive reviews. Things to be warned of though: - the staff were largely very friendly, but we got lost walking into town (we weren't told you had to pre-book the hourly shuttle bus, which was full when we first wanted it); the receptionist marked the hotel location on the map they gave us completely inaccurately(!) and we were never given very clear instructions of where we should have gone over a 3-day stay; the Concierge told us each day we would have to book to see the Borghese Gallery the next day, but at c. 9am each day told us it would already be fully booked that day; and we were only ever helped to take the Ciao Roma city-tour bus rather than any other (which was super), but we weren't told the first time we had to pre-book a ticket to get on it! - the pool looked super, but isn't open until May, and when we wanted a drink outside in the very pretty gardens, were told we couldn't because they had put no cushions out on the iron seats; - the Baby Restaurant is indeed fantastic and charmingly staffed, but very very expensive (still worth a visit though!); - the Grill Restaurant was less charmingly staffed by the hotel bar-staff when they have a spare moment, which offers a minimal published menu and while they serve other more substantial meals, they don't know what they might offer without going to enquire. My overall impression was that the hotel is over-staffed and under-managed, but we did have a super time! If you want tranquility and comfort with largely very friendly staff, this is a great place to stay, but you do have to travel or walk quite a way to see any of the main sites - which of course are all stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Aldrovandi”
Reviews.Author: ScottyandElls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on valantines weekend (fed 08) with my girlfriend. The hotel is very nice inside, and the staff are very pleasant/helpfull. The rooms are very tidy, and the complimenty turn down service at night leaves you with slippers next to your bed and chocalates. The hotel room is equipped with complimenty bathrobes, slippers, shompoo's etc, bowl of fruit, and a bottle of water. The bathromm is very big, huge bath, and lovely. Things to note: Whilst we stayed there, there are renovation works in the lobby, this is not noisy at all, and you will harley notice it. The hotel is very expensive inside, the resturant Babys is 300Euro per head, so i would not eat in the hotel. The hotel provide a free taxi to the spanish steps (central location) on every hour 10am-7pm mon-sat. This is great. The hotel is not right in the centre and it is 7euro into the centre of rome, 10euro to the vatican. I would reccomend you use the shuttle bus, they drop you off an dpick you up at 25past each hour. One in the city, you must walk rome, as you get to see a lot more. The hotel will provide you with a map. As for noise, the renovations are very quiet. We stayed in a room next to the road, and it was not noisy at all. Last thing, bring a travel iron, the hotel room will not provide you with an iron, they charge 15euro for an ironing service, and you must give the item in bye 10am that day. Overall, the hotel is lovely and i would reccoment it to everyone. The bad reviews must be very moany people, as the hotel is wonderful. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Aldrovandi”
Reviews.Author: aineo
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about previous reviews after we had booked the Aldrovandi, but there was no need to worry at all. The hotel was lovely with nice spacious rooms. The staff were excellent and very friendly. The breakfast buffet was fantastic, just what you needed for a long day ahead of sightseeing and walking. There was a courtesy car from the hotel to the centre every hour which was great. It does not matter that the hotel is out a few minutes from the centre as the courtesy car or indeed the lovely walk through the gardens to get to the centre was fine. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Aldrovandi Palace - Roma”
Reviews.Author: DavidandSteve
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about some of the reviews of this hotel prior to our trip to Rome but would reassure visitors that this is a very good hotel and worthy of the Leading Hotel of the World Status. Its true that there are more central hotels but taxis are cheap and plenitful and witihin a 10 euros ride to any of the main attractions. Contary to previous reviews the staff were very courtious, professional and we were upgraded to a Suite which was excellent. I will be returning to this hotel on our next visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Renovations and surly management”
Reviews.Author: mavrou
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find our room wasn't ready until 3pm. We had just disembarked from a cruise ship in Genoa and flown into Rome so we were rather tired. FInally got our room which should have been a view of the avenue. We were given a room which seemed to be in the basement and overlooked the electricity housing and if you looked up you could see the feet of people walking along the avenue. The airconditioning didn't work the whole time we were there. We asked for maintenance and were assured it had been repaired but each night we sweated and had to open the windows and be subjected to the Rome traffic and the killer mosquitoes. Opposite our room there had decided to renovate those three rooms. There were dust sheets and polythene along the corridor and we had to trapse along these to get to our room. Apparently they had overbooked and we received an apology for the inconvenience. During the day if you didn't go out and stayed in the room, you had to listen to constance banging and drilling. The swimming pool area, although very picturesque is poorly staffed. I waited 15minutes for towel for the beds. We are a well travelled couple and this had to be one of the worst experiences we had encountered. Even the reply to the letter sent to Luxury Hotels of the World was inadequate. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it for the pool”
Reviews.Author: sgdbg
Reviews.Content: After a steaming 4 days in tourist Rome, I took my son to the Aldrovandi because it had a pool. Although next to the Borghese Gardens and near the Museum of Contemporary Art and the Villa Guila, it is located in a residential area and far enough away from the heart of Rome to make it difficult to find decent food. Given such a captive audience, every drink and morsel was terribly expensive and merely adequate - $16 euros for coffee and croissants, $6.00 for a bowl of rice krispies. We did not brave the restaurant "Baby" (yes, an awful name) on the ground floor because it simply is not for children. But food isn't all that's amiss. The hotel itself is in dire need of renovation. It seems mired in some 1950 version of Soviet luxury -while the lobby is vast, it is unappealing; the breakfast dining area is dated and tacky; and the hallways and common areas need to enter the 20th century. While our room was acceptable, we did have a problem initially when we were given a "freshly cleaned" room that smelled like poison. After having read some responses from TripAdvisor travellers, I was prepared to meet to rude employees - but the situation was handled rather well and we were moved to a different room. The shuttle bus is helpful, but you need to make reservations in advance (particularly if you are going to town during dinner time). And you should know that the shuttle stops at 7:25, so you're on your own with a taxi after that. The pool is a wonderful extravagance in Rome and is even better if you do not have a sight-seeing itinerary. There are only a few things to be aware of: 1. There are stupid foot showers blocking the paths and everyone falls in at one time or another; 2. The pool is not open at night (after 6:00) and 3. there is a rather strange older woman who appears to dominate the scene ( I got the impression that she might even have formerly owned the place as everyone deferred to her and she had constant service) and who constantly reprimands children, jumpers and splashers. Best bet - go if you need cool water, but there are much nicer places to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy family experience”
Reviews.Author: PaddyBristol
Reviews.Content: We, a family of four, stayed at the Palace at the end of August to mark a significant birthday. A junior suite and a twin room were booked and were ready for us on arrival and next door to each other as requested. The rooms were ok despite the fact that they were on the road side of the hotel rather than the garden and were low down. But we didn't come to Rome to spend time in the rooms! A bottle of champagne and bowl of fruit in the suite were a nice touch. The noise wasn't too bad at all. But we do live in a city. As everyone agrees, the pool is great. Unbeatable to have this in the city during the summer. The pool attendants were very helpful indeed. The Concierge function was excellent. Could not have been more helpful. They recommended and booked local restaurants and the Villa Borghese and were friendly with it. I wonder if there is something about treating them with respect and friendliness? Similarly the reception staff were efficient and helpful. I did note that when a few guests acted in a superior manner the atmosphere got a little frosty. The shuttle service to the Spanish Steps is great although the walk through the park is lovely. The lift back up the hill is appreciated however. Don't forget to book it at reception in advance as it is popular. The only negative point was that the hotel restaurant 'Baby' was closed for a private wedding party one evening. Not a major burden given the good restaurants near by, but hotel restaurants should be open for guests by definition. Also breakfast is ridiculously expensive. Instead take the shuttle to the Spanish Steps and have breakfast upstairs in the cafe opposite. It has a great view of all the comings and goings on the Steps. Not a cheap place to stay, but we concluded that it was worth the money and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Tamworthy
Reviews.Content: I selected this Hotel because of its proximity to the Galleria Borghese and the Galleria Nationale d'Arte Moderne e Contemporanea. On the plus side it is close to the wonderful, peaceful parklands. It is ,however, one of the noisiest hotels I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. Despite my requesting a quiet room some weeks in advance, when I arrived I was told there were none left. They offered to move me to a quieter room the next night. This did not happen. I spent three nights listening to continual traffic. When I complained I was told that they could do nothing! This Hotel should be honest about the noise levels. Unless you go to bed in a drunken stupour you will find this a noisy hotel. The rooms were obviously decorated 20 years ago and are in need of a make over. The showers are hand held and weak. Don't rely on the hairdryer, it would be quicker drying your hair out the window. The Hotel has a wonderful pool and outdoor area, away from the street. The food is expensive 16 Euros for a plate of broth! It has a strangely named restaurant called " Baby", which produces good food at a price and a grill room that offers expensive snacks/drinks. One can take a leisurely stroll through the wonderful parklands nearby to Via Veneto. There are some wonderful Restaurants off Via Veneto. I would recommend Papa Baccus Restorante in Via Toscania. Despite the interesting English spellings on the menu the food is excellent. This street is behind the Marriott. The Aldrovandi Palace is a a noisy faded beauty manned by bemused staff. Unless you like to sleep on the street, I would give this place a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Samba
Reviews.Content: The Aldrovandi Palace Hotel owes this favorable review as much or more to the location and other amenites, as opposed to the hotel facility itself. Located in the "green lung" of Rome behind the Borghese Gardens, the location even in the heat of summer felt resort like and offered a relatively quiet environment. The hotel pool is cool and refreshing and the outdoor cafe is a wonderful place to have lunch. Sandro, the cafe manager, was one of the best hosts we have encountered on our travels throughout the world. Were the front desk as committed to customer service as much as Sandro is, the overall experience would have been superb, but it was not. We were, however, able to overcome our annoyance on arriving from New Jersey to find our room not ready though it had been requested. Also ignored was our request to have an upper level floor in the back and away from the sounds of streetcars in the front of the hotel. We were moved, but the request from our travel agent for an early check-in and back room had been totally ignored until our arrival. Based on the location, pool and outdoor cafe, we would return to the Aldrovandi Palace Hotel without a hesitation in summer time. We can't imagine a more pleasant environment in a big city at that time of year. We might consider other properties in non summer months, however, as the room itself was very ordinary, the front desk concierge service flawed (in its accuracy on certain tourist information and overall helpfulness) , and though we reported our tub/shower leaking on 3 occasions, it had not been fixed by the time we left and we were there for 3 days prior to going on to Sardinia. So any readers of this review would need to look at it from a seasonal perspective with a high rating given for a summer accomodation and a more questionable rating at other times of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, staff not so great”
Reviews.Author: garysummerhill
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a beautiful location. The rooms are excellent with high standards of decor and finnish. The free shuttle bus which runs hourly unitl 7pm is superb and drops you at the spanish steps, this service also picks up at 25 minutes past the hour, again unitl 7.25. The bus driver is by far the friendliest member of the hotel team. We have been lucky enough to stay in some of the worlds best hotels including the Royal Mirage in Dubai and the Chateau Whistler in Canada. In both of these hotles the staff are attentive.polite and would care for your every need, this is not the case at the Aldrovandi Palace. We were ignored whilst standing at the front desk, then once we actually got to speak to someone he stopped midway through the conversation he stopped us to answer the phone and proceeded to be on it for 6 minutes. Everything was a problem to the Concierge and to be quite honest neither of them could really be bothered talking at all.We were made to feel very insignificant. One other point is that if you have booked breakfast there is no variation of the buffet which is a bit dissapointing for a hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “nice but expensive ...pool was awesome”
Reviews.Author: dfinnyc
Reviews.Content: stayed during my honey moon so wanted it to be perfect.. i paid more than i would have on normal occasions, but rome is expensive anyway ...room was of decent size..no problem with that .. it was clean ...hotel lobby is nice but not overwhelming ...the ouside looks pretty grand .. staff was friendly and helpful... no surprises with the bill (exactly what we were quoted) ... pool is excellent ..better than expected... they offer cushions, towels and all that with no charge location was a litle out of the way , but you need to take a cab to any major sights no matter where you stay really .. they called cabs and they came within minutes if not seconds.. they all were honest and didn't try to rip us off either..you may save a few euro on cabs if you stay on the other side of the park, but at that piont, if you booked this place, a few euro does not make a difference..we didn't use the shuttle to the spanish step ..i guess we were too lazy one problem, no iron in the room and non provided... like that in venice and florence also ...we took advantage of their ironing service... one men's shirt, one womens shirt, one women's pair of pants ... 45 euro $62 .... are you kidding ?... pack carefully or be wrinkled... make sure you get breakfast with your rate ... we didn't .. the buffet was 33 euro per person ..., yes , $47 per person .. insane ! so, if u have money to burn, stay there... if not , stay there, but be prepared.. i will say that the pool was awesome ... great lanscaping and very relaxing ..it was like miami beach back there and it was not crowded.. if u stay in the winter, you miss one of the hotels best features that sets it apart from other rome hotels so don't stay there ... we went out till 5 am one night and got shut out of the hotel by gates, but they eventually let us in ...so, be careful if u get back late .. it seems all european hotels do this for some reason so this is not a knock on the place overall, it was a nice hotel, clean, good staff...but not the best i have ever stayed in ... and, the services are insanely priced

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: suedowson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a lovely location next to the beautiful villa borghese gardens. It's best asset is it's pool (a must in the heat of summer) and the staff were very attentive and friendly. The staff at the pool restaurant, particularly the senior waiter, were first class. The rooms were what one would expect from a 5 star hotel and were immaculately clean. The main entrance and reception area was tastefully decorated and the bar quiet but pleasant. we used the shuttle bus quite often to the spanish steps but also taxi's which we found to be reasonable (between 7-10 euros) into the city centre. This would be an ideal location for people who like to walk as it is only a 15 minute stroll across the park to the via veneto and the main sights of rome are all close-by. A must for those who like to escape the hustle and bustle of city centres.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mirry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in April for my birthday. We booked on the recommendation of our local TravelCounsellor and as always were not disappointed. Based on some of the reviews I wonder how other people go about booking their holidays. We always think about where to go, what to do bear in mind what is important to us. Tip 1: Do not book this hotel if you want to be in the centre of the city. It is in a fantastic location opposite a beautiful park and is a haven in an incredibly busy city. You will have to get a shuttle/taxi into town but it is well worth it for the benefits. We did walk out from town one evening and it was fine, we enjoying walking and there is PLENTY of sights to take in on the way home (but take a map) Tip 2: This is a quality hotel with beautiful interiors and classic furnishings. Do not book this hotel if you will not appreciate this. If you want a hotel with cheap and 'jazzy' patterns and every room a carbon copy of the next go elsewhere. We loved everything about this hotel: 1 The staff were 'grown up', very polite and helpful - we did encounter a few problems with our booking but the staff sorted this out quickly. 2 We booked on a bed & breakfast basis and was the best value way to book. The breakfast was amazing, it was a beautiful room and you could even choose which view you preferred. The food/coffee was really good and we ate at various times and the room was never busy. It really was the perfect start to a busy day sightseeing. 3 The room itself was a standard room overlooking the front of the hotel - we had no issues with noise. The furnishings were lovely - we had no problem with the antique mirrors!! 4 The bar in the hotel - although small and not exactly buzzing was very nice and relaxing - nice bar snacks. The outside pool area is also beautiful and lovely for a morning walk. 5 Staff at the front door were very friendly and always got taxis and informed us how long they would be. Rome is a beautiful city and this was the perfect hotel for a base. Take any negative reviews with a pinch of salt!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aldrovandi Palace”
Reviews.Author: SPARKY4
Reviews.Content: July 2007-Just returned from Italy-Wonderful stay at the Aldrovandi Palace, Rome (just outside Villa Borghese area). Travelling with husband, 2 adult children, 1-15 yr. old. I have been to Rome 4 other times but selected this hotel for the pool, and location away from the rush of the city. It is only 5 minutes to Spanish Steps and hotel offers car service. Book a room over the pool! We stayed at the pool everyday during the heat between 2-5 o'clock!! It was perfect! Everyone at the hotel was attentive (especially appreciated by fussy NJ/NYorkers! Rooms are not enormous (this is Italy) but the view, baths, and linens were lovely and clean!! Would highly recommend if you want to get only minutes from all the crowds....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but has drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: 5*Hotelreviewer
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel as we needed some R&R & it has a swimming pool & garden. A major draw back is its distance from the centre of Rome. Although the hotel has a shuttle bus it only runs once an hour and not in the evenings - taxi's were expensive and we frequently had to wait some time to get one. Although we only booked a standard room it was fantastic. Quiet, overlooking the gardens with a separate sitting room. Plus it had all the extras expected of a 5* hotel - robe, slippers, turndown service etc. Breakfast was very expensive €14 for plate of fruit & €8 for toast. The buffet was over €30. There are no other places nearby so it's not an option to eat out locally. Bar drinks & laundry were also costly as was the restaurant - where the food was disappointing & portions small. What sets a good 5* hotel apart from others is the service when there is a problem. The day we left to fly home there was a taxi strike. We only found out about it by accident. The hotel made no attempt to alert guests to it & had not made alternative arrangements to ensure guests could get to the airport - their solution was to get a bus to the train station & from there to the airport. This was not an option for us with heavy luggage. It was only by chance we managed to find alternative transport & no thanks to the staff on reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit - Experience for yourself!”
Reviews.Author: B00Radley
Reviews.Content: I have to say that if we had taken the reviews seriously we would not have booked this hotel. (Nor would I have done the Waldorf in New York for my honeymoon come to think of it! - that was excellent also, as it happens!) Firstly we decided to pre book a limo on-line from and to the airport for 55 euros each way. Yes its cheaper on the train, however,it is far less hassle in heat of 30° plus and it isnt much more than the cost of a taxi. I can't fault our room. No there wasn't a coffee/tea making facility in the room but not many hotels outside the UK offer this. It may well have been refurbished in comparison to some of the traveller's photos posted but it was spotlessly clean, not huge no but if you want to live in your hotel room book a junior suite or larger. Air con was fine but might not be available year round. Decent sized bathroom. The room faced the park and yes you had to squint around the trees and the view was mainly of the road below. If you want a pool and garden facing room then, one must request it. There was a button next to the window for the electrically operated metal window shutters. Once fully down they acted as blackout blinds and masked road noise. My companion slept soundly for the entire 3 nights whilst I didn't but then I do live in the middle of the countryside with no neighbours or road noise. For reference our room was 407. The grounds and pool area were a welcome retreat after a long day sightseeing. The late evenings there were tranquil and with a glass of wine or champagne in hand we discussed our days or, simply marvelled at the wonderful surroundings. The staff were nothing but professional and hardworking. Yes breakfast was expensive at over 30 euros per person. We found that you sit outside a café for an hour with the locals with a cappuccino and pastries in hand on the Via Veneto for approx 12 euros for the both of us! The shuttle bus goes hourly from 10am until 7pm to the Spanish steps but if you ask in advance they will stop en route to drop you off! This they did several mornings, as we booked the hop on hop off city tour of rome with the concierge at the hotel desk for 19 euros each. We joined it at the main bus point across from the Savoy Hotel on the via Ludovisi just off the Via Veneto. It is a fantastic and cost effective way of seeing all the major sites of rome and runs until approx 7pm at night. The shuttle leaves the far end of the square at the bottom of the Spanish steps at 25 past the hour to return. Taxi fares are only 8-10 euros, this is very reasonable compared to some cities in Europe. We didnt have the opportunity to dine in the hotel restaurant as we were too busy sight seeing. We discovered a fantastic ice cream parlour at the bottom of the Spanish steps and made it our own :) Our last night was spent dining at the rooftop restaurant at the Hotel Hasler at the top of the Spanish steps. Expensive yes but well worth it and, if you book ask for a table next to the panoramic window as the views of Rome are to die for! Would we stay again? Absolutely. Rome is a shopper's paradise, a sightseers dream and simply too big not to want to return and see a great deal more. Next time however I think we shall go when the temperatures are not so high as you quickly wilt in the heat. Not many hotels in Rome have a pool to cool off in so, if you want the best of both worlds this is the hotel for you. Remember if you want a pool facing room ask for it, if you want a quiet room ask for it, if you want to ensure your room is newly refurbished, just ask and, if you expect the staff to be any more friendly than they already are then learn the language!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Klaassen
Reviews.Content: Booked this place as it is one of the few hotels in Rome in our price range that had an outdoor swimming pool as along with sight seeing we wanted some R & R in the sun. Unless you seeking a hotel with a pool I would recommend you stay elsewhere. There is no way the rooms are 5 star , more like 3* we cabbed it everywhere as one walks so much in Rome seeing the sights that the extra 20 min across the park did not seem appealing. The staff were all very good service was 5* and the setting 5* but the rooms are NOT and you will be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: J.Austen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aldrovandi Palace for 5 nights (the last week in May 07). I booked a deluxe double king with a Villa Borghese view which was large with a view of the pool and gardens. The room was quiet, furnished to a high standard and well appointed. The bathroom had double sinks, and was bright and reasonably large. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant "Baby" as we wanted to sample as many different restaurant 's while staying in the city as possible. However we did order room service twice and found the food to be of a very high standard. The overall service provided by the hotel staff was of a very high standard, no request was too difficult. The location is definitely a 15 minute walk from the Spanish Steps but taxi's are plentiful and the hotel door men will ring one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but way over priced. Not a business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Setter-SF
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a nice hotel. Service, staff, public areas, food were are all wonderful. The lobby area was large and appointed with luxurious furnishings. But the room just didn't meet expectations. Rome is an expensive city for hotels, especially during vacation season. I attended a small conference at the hotel and, with some reticence, paid the 330 Euros (plus tax) for a basic room, rather than finding another hotel nearby. While the room was quite small, the furnishings were nice: great linens, big window, well-stocked (but expensive) mini-bar. The bathroom was relatively large and well lit. On the downside, the furniture was well-worn (not in a good way), the carpet was not clean (toenail clippings next to the desk), and everything in the hotel was vastly overpriced. Little things were bothersome: a faceplate on an electrical outlet fell off when I touched it. The rack of hooks on the back of the bathroom door was broken and hanging limply. Internet in the room was broken the first night. (Although the second night wasn't much better -- they asked for 25 euros for 24 hours! Fortunately there was free WiFi in the hotel lobby.) I was lucky to be in Rome during warm weather and the air conditioning worked great. However, it's clear that the system is designed to blow cold air only in summer and warm air only in winter. If you experience unseasonal weather during your stay, the AC probably won't help. (The windows did open however.) While the bathroom was large, the shower was old-school Italy: a narrow tub with a hand-held shower unit and a hook in the middle of the wall at eye level to hold the shower unit. End result: an awkward, cramped unsatisfying shower experience. The bathroom amenities were adequate, and ventilation was good. As for services, the hotel knows how to deliver the 4 star experience. Wonderful garden and pool (although I didn't swim), friendly staff, and efficient communications. My colleague was upgraded to a suite with butler service. First morning, he had a knock on the door asking if they could iron his shirt. Yes, of course, but it came back with a 15 euro bill. (Oddly, when I asked the concierge for a shoe shine, that was free.) Business-wise, the hotel clearly doesn't cater to the business traveler. There were no electrical outlets near the desk, and the internet access was outrageously expensive. There is a business center: a small room with two PCs and a printer, fortunately all free. The neighborhood was quiet and obviously rich. I could see embassies and grand residences just across the street from the hotel. Closest restaurants and shops were a 10 minute walk. Taxi into town was about 10 Euros, though, so not a big deal. I didn't try the shuttle service. All in all, it was a nice hotel with some problems in the rooms and definitely not worth the price, unless you plan to spend lots of money on food and services at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Website - 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katie_Jack
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend in Rome in April and decided to push the boat out and book a room at the Aldovandi Palace having been so taken in by their website. Be warned, if you book a standard room do not be fooled by the photos and expect a similar standard. The room we were given was on the ground floor, was tiny, tired and had a very 70s looking mirrored wall. We both felt very upset and so I went straight back to the reception and spoke to the manager. To their credit they immediately showed me a deluxe room and upgraded us free of charge. This room was a little more like the sumptuous settings as portrayed on their website. The air conditioning, however, did not work and so we slept with the window open all night which kept us largely awake with the constant trafic and trams. On a plus, the breakfasts were the best we have ever had in a hotel. The choice was enormous and very delicious. This hotel Im sure was once one of the leading small hotels of the world. However, it now has a very dated and tired feel throughout and probably not worth the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: heme34
Reviews.Content: We-wife and I-arrived in Rome late April and checked in to hotel near Spanish Steps. Unfortunately the temp in Rome was about 85 degrees F and air conditioning which had been stated as feature in website was not available until May 1.We did not feel we could sleep well on street fron with windows ope to street nois and had been flying for many hours, so called and visited the Aldrovandi where I had a reservation for 4 days later. They offered to take us that night or the next; a/c was working. We returned to first hotel and tried to get them to release us but had to pay 2 nights stay or not, so we stayed that night and moved to other next day. Aldrovandi is a great hotel with all facilities in a residential part of Rome next to Borghese Park. They have free shuttle service to the Sp. Steps each hour. Lovely outdoor pool, garden and courtyard. Breakfast was best we had in 3 weeks in Europe. Staff wonderful and had upgraded suite that was gorgeous. Was a pleasure to stay there 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Zdrale
Reviews.Content: Went away with my boyfriend the weekend just gonne and just wanted to clarify the missunderstanding about the rooms. When we checked in on Friday night the service was good and then we were take to our room 502. To say the least were very dissapointed, very old dated decor and depressing. The standard of the room was no more then 3 stars, bathroom also dated and old. I complained at the reception and said they are missleading the guests with the pictures on their website and what exactly they are getting for not a cheap 300 euros per night! The next day we were moved to the other side of the hotel where the rooms have been refurbished. A complete different experience altogether. Everything was brand new and a very pleasant experience. Also to make it up to us they delivered fresh fruit, biscuits and some bubbly. Be careful with the hotel and what room you get...rooms are worlds apart.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star Property”
Reviews.Author: 92103Traveler
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel after seeing The Leading Hotels of The World. This hotel is nice, but not a 5 star property. The pool area is beautiful, however the rooms are 3 star at the most. Rooms are tiny and if you're facing the main road, they're noisy. You'll find that the cars aren't loud, but the electric train that runs in the middle of the street will keep you awake. I would recomend this hotel if you have a pool view. However, I think I'll try another hotel on my next stay. Also, the hotel has a really firm mattress that is common for European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what it is trying to be”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBLeeds
Reviews.Content: We were fully aware of the location of the hotel - it was a pleasant 20 minute walk to Piazza Navona. We must have been upgraded because our room was very pleasant, apart from the wasps that plagued us. The staff are rather "snooty" and there was a certain superiority of which member one could talk to. The bar was the oddest ever, playing dance music, which did not fit in with the atmosphere. I failed to take account of previous reviews and spent €25 each on breakfast, which in all my years of travelling was the worst, overpriced breakfast that I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jorgio
Reviews.Content: this 5 star hotel was rather disappointing. The pictures of the website suggest something spectacular but the reality is a bit different. location is very good, near villa borghese, and the hotel still has a "grand" image but there are sign of tiredness all around. My "superior" room (ie the more basic category) was rather small and not particularly pleasant. Actually it even had two problems: the window did not open and the toilet flush did not work properly ,so that you had to fiddle with the control to make it stop. At > 300Euro per night I think one could find something better, even in Rome when often hotel room prices verge on the absurd

Reviews.Title: “Nice but....”
Reviews.Author: Friendlytips1
Reviews.Content: Staring from the beginning, reservations for the hotel were simple and hassle free. When I asked for a car to pick us up from the aiport, we were being charged €140 which was extorniate (we got one eventually for €50) for all of us but not through the hotel. We had 3 rooms booked which were comfortable and nice but nothing outstanding that I would expect from a hotel which is part of the lhw.com group. It is situated really on a busy road and not within easy walking distance of anywhere - no shops etc near it. However the shuttle bus is good when it goes hourly to the centre of Rome. Staff cannot also be faulted, always helpfula nd friendly. My biggest gripe with this hotel was the prices for food and beverages. I know it is Rome but €25 for 2 plates of chips is ridiculous... in addition, we were a group comprising of 2 children and 1 elderely person and not everyone was going to eat approx €30 of breakfast each - we ended up paying something like €80 for a bowl of porridge and cornflakes, fresh fruit, 3 teas and 2 juices...I think the hotel could be more flexible and not charge a la carte for each item...the mark up is huge. Also we woke one night with the heat and I know there is a system of not turning off heating in commercial building until later on in the year,.. but there was no option of air conditioning either and we couldnt open the windows as our room was on the road and it was too noisy. Overall, we enjoyed it - however we were lucky to get a chepaer rate due to the time of year, I certainly would not have paid the rate of €400 + being asked for during high season.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it..... but (there's always a but)”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Aldrovandi. We had three rooms (one for my parents, one for us and one for our two sons). Before we arrived the hotel was quite helpful, arranging babysitters on a couple of evenings so we could book 'grown up' dinners outside the hotel. The staff were all very friendly and courteous. The rooms, although not very large, were quite modern with comfortable beds, nice bathrooms and sufficient wardrobe space. The cable TV didn't have any channels for kids, but another reviewer had already identified that shortcoming so we were ready for it - we took a DVD player and that was fine. After all, we weren't planning to spend much time in the room anyway! We didn't try the 'Baby' restaurant because the menu looked rather fussy and quite expensive (the degustation menu was EUR 95 I think). However we did eat in the less-formal grill-room once. It was a bit disappointing (in fact, room service, which we used for the kids a couple of times, was better!) It was also quite expensive -- EUR 350 for six people, for a very mediocre meal with just one bottle of wine. Breakfast was extensive -- and expensive, at EUR 33 per person. My recommendation would be not to bother with the hotel's dining facilities at all, unless you can get a B&B rate. There is a shuttle minibus down the Piazza di Spagna every hour (at xx:00 there, and xx:25 back), but we were six people and found on more than one occasion that there wasn't space. However the hotel will allow you to call and book a special pickup, which we did once. There is also a reasonably efficient taxi booking service run by the concierge (although note if you are more than four people getting a large vehicle is nigh on impossible, we frequently had to take two cabs). The gardens are lovely -- try to get a room on that side of the hotel, as the rooms over the road-side can be a little noisy according to my parents (who were woken by the early-morning trams a couple of times). Unfortunately the outdoor pool doesn't open until 01-May so we weren't able to enjoy that facility. Nor did we try the gym. Overall, a nice hotel and a haven outside town (a few minutes walk from Villa Borghese) after a busy day sightseeing. Now for the 'but'.... 1. We did have some problems with cabs -- they wouldn't take bookings so you had to call/go down and ask for one 5-10mins before you needed it, and then take your chances. 2. The aircon in our room was not 100% reliable -- and the first time we complained, they were pretty adamant that it was us and not the machine that was at fault. When we came back at 1am from a restaurant and found the room at 25 or 26 degrees I had to yell at them to fix it right then and there, which isn't the way I want to end a nice evening. 3. The food in the hotel was an over-priced disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane95
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a wonderful stay at the Aldrovandi Palace. Having read the varied reviews I was a little apprehensive about this hotel. However, I really can't praise the hotel enough. The hotel staff were extremely professional, helpful and friendly. Our room had a garden view and was immaculate. It was compact but beautiful. It was cleaned twice daily and the maids couldn't have been more helpful. The breakfasts were 33 euros each, which was rather expensive, but on a positive note, there was plenty of variety and the food was of a very good quality. Having eaten out during the day, we found that it was cheaper to eat in the hotel in the morning rather than find somewhere during the day. The shuttle bus runs from the hotel on the hour to the Spanish Steps and returns at 25 past the hour. The hotel are more than happy to call a taxi for you. Please be aware......We paid 70 Euros from the airport and was 'ripped off' by the taxi driver. The cost from the airport should have been 40 Euros, but we didn't know at the time. Also be aware of the beggars and romanian women with babies who have perfected the art of pick pocketing. We had our purse stolen, but luckily got it back. Keep hold of your bags and make it difficult for them. A bum bag would possibly have been better to carry our belongings in. All in all I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: nolsN.Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is where we spent our first week as husband and wife, and it could not have been better. The hotel staff were professional, friendly, accommodating, efficient and helpful. The hotel was spotlessly clean, as was our room. The room was compact but very comfortable and relaxing. On arrival we recieved champagne and pasteries which had been placed in our room. The breakfasts were great and plentiful, on our departure day they gave us a takeout breakfast as we were leaving the hotel at 08.00. An added bonus is the shuttle bus which drops off at the Spanish steps, and picks up every hour until 19.25. Outside the hotel a tram passes regularly which passes St. Peters square. The hotel is located in a beautiful tranquil area of Rome, with the stunning gardens of the Villa Borghese on the doorstep of the hotel. An amazing holiday overall. We highly reccommend this hotel and Rome!!!!! Mr & Mrs O Hagan N. Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Porky-Borky
Reviews.Content: I am so happy to see that others have enjoyed the Aldrovandi as much as we always have. We have visited many hotels in Italy and always look forward to going back to the Aldrovandi. It has two great attractions for us, namely location and staff. The location supplies peace and quiet and enough space for gardens and a pool, yet handy for the centre. It might not appeal to anybody wanting to be plunged into the thick of thing in the Rome Centre, but for us it is marvelous to return to a warm welcome after a day of intensive shopping and sight-seeing. The hourly shuttle is a boon, & a taxi from the centre should be about 10 Euros (or a little more at night). The walk via the Borghese Gardens is only 20 mins or so, but I wouldn't recommend it after dark . The gardens/zoo also make for a lovely early morning walk if (like me) you are up an hour before your partner has finshed her "toilettte". Contrary to some earlier comments, we have always found the staff to be welcoming, cheery and very helpful. Whilst they retain a small degreee of formality as becomes a 5* hotel, they are still more friendly than any other hotel I have stayed at. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Old-school European five star luxury”
Reviews.Author: adamlegge
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful four day break in Rome, staying at the Aldrovandi. If you’re looking for the modern, ultra-hip five star experience there are plenty of options in this great city, the Exedra, the Aleph etc. But if you want the five-star European luxury hotel done like it used to be then you could so a lot worse than the Aldrovandi. When I’ve stayed in Rome before it’s always been in the city centre but one of the best things about this lovely hotel is the fact that you’re about 4-5 minutes taxi ride from the tumult of Roma, on the outskirts of the Villa Borghese. The hotel runs an hourly shuttle to the Piazza del Spagna. But we either took taxis or enjoyed the 20 minute walk across the park- either to the Spanish Steps or to the Piazza del Popolo, enjoying the incredible views over the city before descending into the piazza. I can honestly say we couldn’t fault the service at the Aldrovandi- from check in to check out. The concierges were unfailingly helpful, suggesting and reserving restaurants. Some of the other comments here about rude or difficult staff could not be more different from our experience. Our room was on the small size but incredibly comfortable (with a park view) and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was good- maybe a little lacking in variety but fine. I can’t comment on the restaurant- Baby- as we ate out every night. One example of the Aldrovandi’s service sums up why we enjoyed it so much. Our key was exactly that- a metal key on a heavy red tassel which we handed in every morning to the concierge, to be retrieved by him as he saw us come through the door, ready to hand over to us with a Buona Sera!

Reviews.Title: “Aldrovandi.....just lie going home”
Reviews.Author: WalesBarney55
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Rome and at the Aldrovandi Palace. We fell in love with Rome in August and decided to return to this wonderfully friendly hotel for New Year. The only disappointment was that the pool was closed and the outside bar area was deserted. A couple of patio heater would have been ideal for sitting out in the evening. We spent New Years Eve at the conciege's suggestion at Harry's Bar and had a wonderful and expensive evening there seeing in 2007. Fantastic!!! The hotel is fab and the conciege knowledgable and helpful, making suggestions for day trips and fab restaurants. I cannot recoomed the hotel highly enough. as a base for Rome. Yes the rooms may be small, however with all of Rome a 5 minute taxi ride away, you'll spend little time in it. The best venue for dinner in Rome is the rooftop restaurant at the Hashe view of Rome and the amazing cuisine. It'll cost you a months mortgage but you'll never forget the view of Rome at dusk and the foods fabulous. I threw a few extra euros into the Trevi fountain to make sure we return to Rome soon and when we do we'll stay at the Aldrovandi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: karenodk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned from a wonderful couple of days in Rome. We stayed at the Aldrovandi Palace Hotel. It was fantastic, it had a sense of old world grandeur. The staff were very welcoming and spoke excellent English. Our rate which we booked through Otel.com included breakfast and it was excellent. I would advise getting a taxi from the airport if there is more than one as its much quicker and works out roughly the same as a train and taxi. We took three Angel Tours. The First to the Vatican was fantastic we had an Irish guide called Anne Marie she was brillant. The second tour was the Heart of Rome, it was good but unfortunately the Pantheon was closed unexpectately so the tour was cut short. The Third tour we took was to the Colesseum and Roman Forum we were the only two people on the tour it was great - a private tour! I can't say enough for Angel Tours, take one you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Granda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an enjoyable six night stay at this hotel. The suite which we were allocated ( Room 607 ) was beautiful. It had a spacious sitting room, separate luggage storage area, a marbled, well appointed and well lit bathroom ( combined bath and monsoon shower cubicle ) and a good sized bedroom with loads of hanging and storage space as well as a king size double bed. The decor, furniture, lighting and bedding were all of a very high standard. We especially liked the pale blue striped silk (?) lined walls throughout and the dramatic pink three piece suite in the sitting room. The traditional tasteful furniture and lamps made it a restful sanctuary to return to after each wonderful but exhausting sightseeing day in Rome. The staff in the hotel were all friendly and professional especially the doorman, Danielle, who went out of his way to be helpful. Getting into the city from this location beside the restful Borghese gardens was easy, an eight minute ride to the Spanish Steps in the hourly hotel courtesy bus or, as Danielle showed us, a fifteen minute, one euro tram ride from right outside the hotel to the Vatican. Because the courtesy bus doesn't operate after 7.30pm we used metered taxis to get back to the hotel on three or four occasions and the fare, including tip, was always under ten euros. The reviewer on these pages who claims they paid up to twenty five euros must have been taken for a ride in more ways than one! We didn't eat in the hotel, apart from the ample quantities of complimentary fresh fruit provided in our room that is, as we wanted to sample a variety of restaurants and cafes in Rome. On that subject may I recommend that you give both 'Piperno' and 'Babington's Tea Rooms', (both recommended in the 'Dorling Kindersley' travel guide), a miss. We found them to be very overpriced at over £70 for a two course lunch for two with one small glass of house wine at 'Piperno' and £35 for one soup and toast, one coffee, one tea and a jam and cream scone at 'Babingtons.' The food was nice in both places, but not that nice! For really good value traditional Italian food try 'Ninos' in Via Borgognona near the Spanish Steps. This was suggested by A.A. Gill in The Sunday Times a couple of weeks ago so we thought we would try it and we were glad we did. We were a bit concerned about going to this hotel because of some of the negative reviews on this site but everything turned out fine. We had intended going to a more central hotel but were unable to get a reservation. On reflection I am glad that we didn't as Rome is so noisy and we may not have enjoyed the peaceful nights sleep which we got here. I'm sorry that we didn't get around to trying the 'baby' restaurant but feel that in terms of the facilities we actually used 'The Aldrovandi Palace' deserves its five star grading.

Reviews.Title: “Third stage of our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CAGP
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 14th of October and the driver took us to a very nice green area (Borghese Gardens) where the Aldrovandi is located (ten minutes walk from the Hotel to Piazza del Popolo and shuttle service all day long to Piazza Spagna). The Hotel is a Palazzo, we stayed in a very nice suite with views of the pool and gardens, classic style mixed with plasma and bang & olufsen music equipment (nice blend). Casual pool restaurant was good and the Baby (1 Michelin star) was beyond expectations in service, food quality, presentation and wines (10/10). During dinner we were introduce to the Chef Alfonso Iaccarino who also has a 3 Michelin Star Restaurant called Don Alfonso in Sant Agata (Amalfi). Concierge and reception were very reliable and can't tell you anything about the breakfast due that we just had cappuccinos in the room every morning. I recommend to go at least once to Mario in Via delle Vite, great food, service and ambience (lunch or dinner). Don't miss the Vatican museum but spend your money in getting a proper guide and be there at 7:30 am, you will be able to enter at 8:00 am and visit the Sistine Chapel with no more than 10 people (when we crossed it again at 11:00 to go to St. Peter's Basilic, there were more than 400 people easily). Ciao Italia, we will be back! Carlos and Natalia

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HollynAndrewnLily
Reviews.Content: My husband and baby daughter stayed here in August and on 1st appearances the hotel was very grand and staff were extremely helpful. Our room was of an average hotel size but it was very dark and quite dingy. The bathroom again was small and of average standard. The TV only had one channel (BBC News24) in english and any childrens channels were 19E each. The pool area was lovely and a very relaxing place to be and the pool attendants and restuarant staff very attentive. There wasn't however enough space around the pool when the hotel was full and fighting for sunbeds actually in the sun became a daily battle. The pool was nice and clean but freezing. We chose this hotel because it had 2 restuarants to eat in and we would have to stay in most evenings because of our baby daughter (babysitting was an option but we only booked twice as it was 20E an hour). The mitchellin starred resturant was nice but very overpriced in my opinion and the 'grill' restuarant grilled nothing! All you could eat there was salads, even in the evening. The menues were very poor throughout the hotel and choice was very limited. Breakfast was disappointing again and again very overpriced at 20E a head. In summary the whole hotel was overpriced and very tired looking. Fantastic shuttle bus I wouldn't stay there again - unless they reduced their star rating and prices.

Reviews.Title: “Cant get a reservation”
Reviews.Author: ADVENTURE4LIFE
Reviews.Content: Ihave tried for two week to get a reservation to take advantage of their special to a 4th night free. It would be less expensive going direct so I have not booked with expedia. I have tried for two weeks without a returned e-mail and none have come back. I want to stay here since I am traveling with my 11 year oild son and would like to take advantage of the pool.The e-mails have not been returned so it must be the staff that is ignoring the request. You can see when someone is online and they have chosen to neglect my inquiry.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a reputable 5* Hotel in Rome, we were very dissapointed with this hotel. The rooms were poorly decorated, staff below average and overall service quite poor. It was one of five 5* hotels we stayed on our honeymoon. Honestly, we will never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to our friends.
